column1: Rutgers University (36759) Hiring Office Location: New Brunswick
column3: Temporary Research Programmer/ New Brunswick NJ
column9: b'The Rutgers Institute for Translational Medicine and Science (RITMS) was founded in January 2016 and is directed by the Vice-Chancellor for clinical and translational science Dr. Reynold Panettieri. RITMS conducts basic research in immunology physiology and molecular biology related to understanding the mechanisms that regulate airway function and leukocyte interactions in asthma chronic obstructive pulmonary disease and adult bronchiectasis. The RITMS also performs unique clinical studies utilizing state-of-the-art pulmonary function testing airway imaging (computerized tomography magnetic resonance imaging \xc2\xb5CT scans and confocal bronchoscopy) and invasive techniques bronchoscopy) to assess airway inflammation and bronchoconstriction. Additionally the RITMS provides one of the only Respiratory Phase II Clinical Research Unit in the United States for drug evaluation. The RITMS is renowned for establishing state- of-the-art clinical and research programs that translate discoveries into new therapeutics for patients with airways disease that also includes orphan diseases such as lymphangioleiomyomatosis and Birt-Hogg- Dube syndrome. Further the RITMS provides unique opportunities for undergraduate graduate and postdoctoral research and clinical education and training. The program is interdisciplinary by nature and multicentric using fundamental and clinical science expertise from the Departments of Medicine Pediatrics Radiology Surgery Pharmacology and Emergency Medicine in the Schools of Medicine and Nursing at the Rutgers University.'
column10: b'The role of the temporary research programmer will be to develop tools and web applications to help facilitate research and experiments within the Rutgers Institute for Translational Medicine and Science. Must be able to perform data analysis and data integration and to develop and implement analysis pipelines. Should be comfortable managing large volumes of high- throughput experimental data. Programming will be in Python and various forms of JavaScript + HTML5 for web development. This will involve using and modifying existing programs written in C C++ Java Python Matlab R and MySQL as well as integrating third-party programs as necessary. You will work mostly independently as a programmer but interface with researchers and scientists daily to gather requirements and understand lab protocols and practices.'
column15: b'Experience with the following languages is required: Python JavaScript HTML5 and good capabilities working with C OOP (C++/Java) JSON XML. Experience with Matlab R is a plus. Applicant should be comfortable with Linux/Unix and MacOS X environments and have working knowledge of Git SQL and web-based applications. Python web apps are built in Django Wagtail and Drupal so familiarity with all is important.'

column1: CHUBB (formerly ACE USA) (554) Hiring Office Location: Philadelphia (4)
column8: b'Chubb is the world\xe2\x80\x99s largest publicly traded property and casualty insurer. With operations in 54 countries Chubb provides commercial and personal property and casualty insurance personal accident and supplemental health insurance reinsurance and life insurance to a diverse group of clients. The company is distinguished by its extensive product and service offerings broad distribution capabilities exceptional financial strength underwriting excellence superior claims handling expertise and local operations globally. The insurance companies of Chubb serve multinational corporations mid-size and small businesses with property and casualty insurance and services; affluent and high net worth individuals with substantial assets to protect; individuals purchasing life personal accident supplemental health homeowners automobile and other specialty insurance coverage; companies and affinity groups providing or offering accident and health insurance programs and life insurance to their employees or members; and insurers managing exposures with reinsurance coverage. With more than $150 billion in assets and $37 billion of gross written premiums in 2014* on a pro forma basis Chubb\xe2\x80\x99s core operating insurance companies maintain financial strength ratings of AA from Standard & Poor\xe2\x80\x99s and A++ from A.M. Best. Chubb Limited the parent company of Chubb is listed on the New York Stock Exchange (NYSE: CB) and is a component of the S&P 500 index. Chubb maintains executive offices in Zurich New York London and other locations and employs approximately 31000 people worldwide. Position will be located in Philadelphia at 5th and Walnut Streets a short train ride from the Drexel campus.'
column9: b'Responsibilities: Assist the Global IT VP of Contracts with Vendor and Contract Management processes related to implementation and monitoring of IT Contracts. Assist the business with the development and modification of a contract repository system known as ServiceNow designed to maximize metric and reporting capabilities\xe2\x80\xa2 Assist with implementation of IT Contracts Management System including data mining data entry and analysis \xe2\x80\xa2 Work with the Global IT Contracts Team with offices in Phila Warren NJ London Singapore and South America to gather information for contract lifecycle management \xe2\x80\xa2 Assist with the preparation and publishing of executive management reporting and presentations \xe2\x80\xa2 Responsible for document management and record retention. column1: EZ Soft
column10: b'EZSoft is a leading provider of Information and Control Systems for the process industries. We provide full vertical integration from the Process Layer to the Manufacturing Operations Layer to the Enterprise Layer and horizontal integration across the Manufacturing Supply Chain. We create component based solutions that enable our customers to control and optimize their manufacturing processes while at the same time deliver timely historical and time based data to the process operations and enterprise levels in the organization. With the goal to shorten the Supply Chain and embrace a make to order philosophy EZSoft has created a suite of Tools and Products that enable Companies to achieve that vision. Our Tools and Products are developed based on the ISA-88 and ISA-95 standards. These Standards facilitate our component based strategy which allows us to be extremely efficient in the delivery cycle'
column11: b'Do you want a job where you can see the results of your work happen in front of you with your own eyes? EZSoft Inc. is a leading Systems Integrator in the field of automation and industrial controls. We specialize and excel in providing proven reliable controls systems for our customers\xe2\x80\x99 manufacturing and business process needs. We are constantly growing and as such we need your help every step of the way from the factory floor PLC logic to data aggregation systems to the reports generated based on that data. You\xe2\x80\x99ll have the opportunity to work with experts both in software development and process design as part of the job. On-the-job training in the software used will be provided as needed. Some travel may be required but not much \xe2\x80\x93 typically only during installation and startup of these systems. We welcome anyone with a background in development (.NET preferred but not required) and basic knowledge of electrical principles is an added bonus as most projects we undertake will involve some electrical design.'

column1: Pfizer (3926) Hiring Office Location: Collegeville
column3: Global Business Intelligence Analyst/ Collegeville PA
column9: b'Pfizer a global leader in the biopharmaceutical industry is continuously seeking top talent who are inspired by our purpose to innovate to bring therapies to patients that significantly improve their lives.'
column10: b'Position Summary Pfizer has an exciting opportunity to join the Global Business Intelligence team as a Co-Op student. A career at Pfizer offers opportunity ownership and impact. All over the world Pfizer colleagues work together to positively impact health for everyone everywhere. Our colleagues have the opportunity to grow and develop a career that offers both individual and company success; be part of an ownership culture that values diversity and where all colleagues are energized and engaged; and the ability to impact the health and lives of millions of people. The SAP Business Intelligence Team is looking for a Co- Op intern to assist with application development data analysis and technical writing. This person should have software development skills data base design knowledge and strong communications skills. Any experience with SAP SAP Business Intelligence Tableau Software or SQL is a plus. This person will have three areas of responsibility. The first will be assisting with the development of SAP BI Data Models SAP BI Queries and SAP Business Objects reporting applications. These applications will provide information through various graphics to measure business performance. The candidate will need to learn this software and then they will participate in design and development of new applications. The second responsibility will be writing and editing computer system documents and manuals. They will assist with the development of training guides and presentations to insure that they are informative and user friendly. This person will assist in training the end user community. The third responsibility will be executing SAP Business Intelligence queries. They will use these queries to extract data and perform analysis. This analysis is an important part of providing the business with metrics and information into order to perform critical decision support activities.'
column15: b'Skills Knowledge and Abilities: \xe2\x80\xa2Any experience with SAP SAP Business Intelligence Business Objects Tableau Software or SQL is a plus. \xe2\x80\xa2Proficient with Microsoft Office (Word Excel and PowerPoint). \xe2\x80\xa2High quality analytical and problem solving skills. \xe2\x80\xa2Logical and efficient with keen attention to detail. \xe2\x80\xa2Effective written and verbal communication skills.'

column1: Wego (143583) Hiring Office Location: Singapore (1)
column8: b"Wego is the most popular travel search engine in Middle East and among the leading players in online travel in Southeast Asia. Dual- headquartered in Singapore and Dubai Wego receives over half a million travel search requests per day through its website and iOS and Android apps. Wego\xe2\x80\x99s mobile apps are highly-ranked in every one of our core markets. Our commitment to great user experiences received mention at Apple\xe2\x80\x99s WWDC conference in June 2017 and Wego was one of the only two Asian companies featured at Google I/O in May 2017. On the web Wego was among the world\xe2\x80\x99s first to implement Google\xe2\x80\x99s AMP technology for mobile web in early 2017. At the same time we are a friendly geeky bunch originating from more than twenty different countries over five continents. We get extremely excited about new technology and innovation and work hard to incorporate the latest and greatest to improve our product at every turn. If you love to max out your brain space with techy acronyms in an energetic and pioneering atmosphere then we think you'll fit right in. Great ping-pong skills definitely an advantage! Apart from being geeks we're also avid travellers. Wego was created to help make travel plans online as simple and easy as possible and we regularly take advantage of our location within Southeast Asia and the largest low-cost airline networks in the world to explore Indonesia Vietnam Thailand the Philippines and more just a short flight away. Immerse yourself in the exotic and fascinating culture of Asia with one of the fastest growing and frankly the coolest companies you're likely to find."
column9: b'As a data analytics co-op at Wego you will work closely with the head of strategy and help conduct a range of analytical reports including competitive analysis gap analysis feature comparison market analysis among others. Reports will ultimately be delivered to company\xe2\x80\x99s CEO and other key decision makers. As part of the role you will also develop and maintain analytic dashboards for use within the company. You will have access to company-wide statistics follow developments in the travel sector and utilise various tools and information services to work with data. Specifically you will have a chance to learn and work with some of the best datasets for business analysis including AppAnnie and Similarweb for competitive analysis; Google Analytics Apsalar for internal analytics; BigQuery Tableau and ChartIO for data collection and visualisations among others. If you love turning data into knowledge connecting the dots and discovering trends to see the real story behind numbers all the while working in a casual start-up atmosphere we would like to invite you to join our strategy & analytics team.'
column10: b'No'
column13: b'While none of the skills below are strictly required and you will certainly have a chance to expand your expertise in all of them a pre- existing familiarity with any of the below is preferred: \xe2\x80\xa2 Data analytic skills: strong command of Excel/Google Sheets; natural inclination to analyse and structure information; strong presentation skills in Google Slides; Tableau. \xe2\x80\xa2 Technical skills: SQL for data extraction; any macros and/or scripting languages such as Python; understanding of JS & CSS. \xe2\x80\xa2 Communication skills: strong communication skills for seamless work with executives; good business writing & presentation skills; being proactive and self-organised. \xe2\x80\xa2 Familiarity with e-commerce/m-commerce: app & website analytics (GA Apsalar) \xe2\x80\xa2 Passion for travel Role is suitable for 3rd and 4th year students.'

column1: JPMorgan Chase & Co (33248) Hiring Office Location: Wilmington
column3: Digital Accessibility Analyst Northern Delaware Wilmington
column9: b'JPMorgan Chase & Co. (NYSE: JPM) is a leading global financial services firm with assets of $2.6 trillion and operations in more than 60 countries. The firm is a leader in investment banking financial services for consumers small business and commercial banking financial transaction processing asset management and private equity. About Digital Services: The Digital Services organization supports Chase\xe2\x80\x99s consumer-facing digital products such as chase.com Chase Mobile and the bank\xe2\x80\x99s payments platforms. Digital Services\xe2\x80\x99 diverse teams have locations across the US and function in a variety of capacities including: Customer Experience Product Management Data Intelligence Analytics and Predictive Personalization Technology and Engineering. Digital Services works closely with all Chase lines of business to ensure a cohesive customer experience that is personalized and simple. As an industry leader Chase strives to be the bank of choice for digitally savvy customers and continues to see record growth in its online and mobile users. The Digital Accessibility team is leading the bank towards a competitive digital experience for ALL of our customers by first achieving standards and regulatory conformance and then adding innovative accessible features & services.'
column10: b'Job Description: JPMorgan Chase seeks an energetic motivated and resourceful individual to join the Digital Accessibility team. The desired candidate is someone who is not only sensitive to the electronic communications access needs people with disabilities have but also will be an individual who will collaborate with the team in ways not yet imagined. As the Digital Accessibility Co-op you will be responsible for: - Supporting Digital Accessibility team in identifying potential barriers to accessibility and suggesting potential solutions which will be in conformance with accessibility guidelines and laws including but not limited to W3C WCAG 2.0 standards compliance with the ADA Section 508 and the Twenty- First Century Communications and Video Accessibility Act. - Assisting in applying accessibility knowledge to the firm\xe2\x80\x99s digital properties including but not limited to web applications mobile applications and electronic documents. - Supporting the team in managing and maintaining the Digital Accessibility Knowledge Base repository. - Assisting in the establishment and implementation of effective accessibility training materials. - Reviewing writing and presenting procedure documents according to standard templates. - Facilitating and tracking procedure reviews and updates. - Defining and meeting key deliverables for assignments and providing updates to management. - Completing assignments in a high quality and timely fashion. - Participating and assisting with meeting facilitation and minutes related to team assignments. - Identifying ways to assist the team in promoting accessibility through various communication methods. - Supporting the roadmap planning and project intake efforts.'
column15: b'The individual should be a self-starter who demonstrates leadership is a creative thinker with a proven ability to define and meet key deliverables. Someone who is an excellent communicator - both written and verbally including the ability to explain solutions in common business language. Strong attention to detail the ability to multi-task and exceptional organizational skills are required. The individual should be comfortable with presenting to senior leaders across the firm and possess the ability to collaborate in a global matrix managed organization. Strong problem solving and time management skills ability to work under pressure and the ability to work independently and in small groups is required. A solid understanding and comfort level with Microsoft Office including Excel Word PowerPoint Visio and Share Point is required. Knowledge of or experience with the following is a plus: - Accessibility barriers resulting from visual impairment hearing impairment cognitive Impairment mobility impairment and / or a combination of multiple disabilities. - Accessibility standards: WCAG 2.0 ADA Section 508 21st Century Video and Communications Act. - Windows and Mac OS Mobile accessibility on Android and IOS. - Screen readers screen magnifiers switch controls. - HTML 4 and 5 CSS 2 and 3. - ALM JIRA Confluence and SharePoint - Experience with Scrum and Agile methodologies - Experience with Internet or mobile usability/accessibility research is a plus This position is open to Pre-Juniors and Juniors with a minimum of at least one (1) previous co-op / internship.'
column17: b'Advanced - Previous related work experience/final Co-op'

column10: b'Looking for highly motivated candidates who want to work for one of the world\xe2\x80\x99s largest providers of commercial property and casualty insurance and reinsurance. With the purpose of providing growth this position offers candidates the opportunity to work in support of the CHUBB Global IT Compliance community. Candidates will become familiar with IT compliance considerations relative to Sarbanes- Oxley PCI COSO COBIT and other frameworks. Candidates will have the opportunity to work with the Metric Stream GRC Tool. Candidates will become familiar with all aspects of control design execution and testing as well as deficiency remediation. Most significantly candidates will receive helpful and sincere guidance from other team members and be welcomed as a part of this team. (Manager is a Drexel Alum!) Major duties and Responsibilities: Provide support for IT control testing and monitoring. Generate reports and document evidence of compliance for all necessary IT controls. Actively participate in various meetings to provide status of and coordinate work efforts. Identify and recommend opportunities to improve information security processes'

column3: Associate Siebel CRM Analyst Co-op/ King of Prussia PA
column9: b'Division: Information Systems Location: King of Prussia PA 19406 Company: CSL Behring is a global leader in the plasma protein Biotherapeutics industry. We research develop manufacture and market biotherapies which are used to treat serious and rare conditions. Users of our therapies rely on them for their quality of life and in many cases for life itself. Our commitment to saving lives and improving the quality of life for people with serious and rare conditions is evident in everything we do. Whether we are manufacturing and marketing safe and effective products or researching and developing innovative biotherapies we are first and foremost focused on fulfilling our customers\xe2\x80\x99 needs. The CSL Behring World Headquarters is located in King of Prussia PA. The Information Systems department at this location has a passionate group of Siebel CRM Analysts that are supporting the design development and support of a global Siebel implementation.'
column10: b'Selected Candidate will work with several environments performing tasks in many of the below areas. The candidate participates in all aspects of software development life cycle on implementation and maintenance of the new Siebel CRM system. The candidate will be part of an existing team of senior functional analysts who will help in mentoring and guiding the candidate. The candidate will support the project team in the following areas: Requirements gathering busines process definition Siebel administration configuration data migration validation and documentation. column1: BresslerGroup (67506) Hiring Office Location: Philadelphia
column9: b'Electrical / Embedded Engineer at BresslerGroup: BresslerGroup is an accomplished award-winning product development consultancy in downtown Philadelphia. We provide a full range of services including design research and innovation strategy industrial and interaction design engineering and production sourcing. We work across consumer commercial and medical categories for start-ups to global brands.'
column10: b'Bressler Group is seeking an Electrical Engineer for our expanding product development team. We are looking for a motivated self-starter and problem solver who will contribute to the continued growth of the company. You will work closely with the electrical mechanical and industrial design groups to design and develop real-time embedded systems for a wide variety of applications including motor control audio wireless applications using Bluetooth WiFi and Zigbee protocols. You must be fluent in firmware design be able to author robust and maintainable code in C/C++/Assembly along with associated documentation. You will tackle both system level and detailed design issues. Requirements: \xe2\x80\xa2 BS in Computer Engineering Electrical Engineering Computer Science or related discipline. \xe2\x80\xa2 Fluent in the C programming language and associated tool- chains \xe2\x80\xa2 Solid understanding of data structures algorithms and programming methodologies \xe2\x80\xa2 Hands on with Real-time Operating Systems (RT/OS) in a resource constrained environment \xe2\x80\xa2 Device drivers programming including ISR UART SPI I2C DMA ADC DAC etc. \xe2\x80\xa2 Communication protocol design Ethernet TCP/IP network programming \xe2\x80\xa2 Digital hardware design and interface; uC DSPs memory schematic entry PCBs etc. \xe2\x80\xa2 Use of oscilloscopes and lab instrumentation. Preferred: \xe2\x80\xa2 Project management system level design system integration \xe2\x80\xa2 ST Freescale Atmel ARM Cortex-M microcontrollers / microprocessors \xe2\x80\xa2 Instrumentation control theory digital signal processing filter design motor control \xe2\x80\xa2 Switching power supplies signal conditioning analog front- end low-noise amplifiers etc \xe2\x80\xa2 Experience developing software in a PC environment C++ C#.NET GUI'
column15: b'Preferred experience in embedded software development schematic capture PCB layout PCB assembly and test. Wide range of projects and opportunities.'

column8: b'About ARI: ARI is a world leader in fleet management and focuses heavily on technology to provide a unique experience to our customers. By delivering highly configurable products and end\xe2\x80\x90to\xe2\x80\x90end services from design development and integration ARI sets the standard for fleet management technology. ARI has also been recognized by Fortune Magazine as one of the \xe2\x80\x9c100 best places to work\xe2\x80\x9d for its family-like culture employee engagement and empowerment programs. About ARI Information Technology: ARI\xe2\x80\x99s Information Technology department is the Fleet Management industry leader in technical innovation. With a team of 200 based in the US Canada UK and Germany there is a constant demand for dedicated enthusiastic and highly capable talent to satisfy the needs of our internal users and external clients. ARI\xe2\x80\x99s Information Technology department was recently awarded one of CIO Magazine\xe2\x80\x99s CIO 100 Innovation Awards for finding ways to change our industry using emerging technologies.'
column9: b'Job Purpose: The Co-Op Developer is a programmer who is expected to work on several internal and external software products for ARI. Co-Op Developers will have an opportunity to gain valuable experience delivering world- class software to over 3000 clients with a truly global reach. Co-Op Developers are expected to work closely with more experienced developers on a regular basis and will have an opportunity to learn while delivering real world business software. Co-Op Developers will regularly have their work reviewed by other more experienced developers. Co-Op Developers are expected to stay abreast of the latest technologies and coding techniques relevant to their work and apply them when possible. Essential Functions: \xe2\x80\xa2 Work with business units to understand requirements for software development and delivery. \xe2\x80\xa2 Learn and help evolve ARI\xe2\x80\x99s technical standards bringing fresh perspective and ideas from the academic world into the commercial space. \xe2\x80\xa2 Perform coding build and maintain software \xe2\x80\xa2 Investigates analyzes and documents reported defects. \xe2\x80\xa2 Creates documents and implements test plans and harnesses to ensure high quality work product. \xe2\x80\xa2 Performs related duties as assigned. \xe2\x80\xa2 Provides reasonable and fair estimates for assigned tasks and work efforts. \xe2\x80\xa2 Keeps current with software development trends make suggestions and take action on IT-related best practices processes and systems.'

column9: b'The Philadelphia Bar Foundation is dedicated to promoting access to justice for all people in the community particularly those struggling with poverty abuse and discrimination. We accomplish this mission by providing grants and technical assistance in support of quality legal services addressing unmet legal needs and providing education on matters in the public interest. column1: Protiviti Inc. (10116) Hiring Office Location: Philadelphia
column9: b"Description At Protiviti we believe that a career is about more than just working providing deliverables and being compensated for your efforts. A Protiviti Career is about opportunities to lead learn grow and make a difference. We strive to recruit and hire the best talent. But it doesn't stop there. Once you join us we build your career through exceptional work experiences a culture focused on learning and development and a commitment to the things that matter to you. Are you inspired to make a difference? You've come to the right place."
column10: b'Co-Ops work in dynamic team-oriented environments where they define technology system or business process issues compile information and analyze data in order to present solutions to our clients. Co-Ops develop an understanding of business processes build technical skills in general risk areas and help our clients review document evaluate and test controls remediate and develop or implement action plans to improve efficiency and effectiveness of business processes. Protiviti\xe2\x80\x99s Co-Ops will work on a variety of projects and solution offerings partnering with executives to ensure their organizations are successful while providing our interns with a broad range of experiences. The primary solutions for interns include Internal Audit and Financial Advisory Technology Consulting and Risk and Compliance. As Consultants progress in their careers the focus shifts from gaining transferable experience to specializing in an industry or solution.'
column15: b'Degree: Candidates pursing a master\xe2\x80\x99s or bachelor\xe2\x80\x99s degree in a relevant discipline (e.g. Accounting Finance MIS or Computer Science). A core curriculum of business courses including accounting coursework is strongly preferred. Minimum GPA: 3.0 overall 3.0 major Visa Status: All applicants applying for U.S. job openings must be authorized to work in the United States. Graduation Status: Must be within one year of graduation at time of internship Skill Requirements: Must work well in a team-oriented environment as well as independently Must work creatively and analytically in a problem-solving environment Must possess excellent leadership communication and interpersonal skills Must have a desire to learn and a receptiveness to feedback and mentoring Must have an interest in finance and accounting processes as they relate to the overall business environment Ability to Travel: The position requires travel to client sites. Consultants must have reliable transportation to and from local client sites. Out-of-town travel also may be required. Note: Students may apply for only one location. Duplicate applications will not be accepted. Protiviti is not licensed or registered as a public accounting firm and does not issue opinions on financial statements or offer attestation services. For all US & Canada Postings: You may submit your application materials online or call 1.888.556.7420 for additional ways to apply. Protiviti is an Equal Opportunity Employer. M/F/Disability/Veteran'

column1: IPS - Integrated Project Services (2791) Hiring Office Location: Blue Bell
column9: b'IPS-Integrated Project Services is a global leader in developing innovative and cost effective solutions for the engineering construction commissioning and qualification of complex pharmaceutical and biotech research and manufacturing facilities. With technical expertise spanning R&D to pilot-scale to large-scale production our team specializes in the technology trends and regulatory environment to successfully deliver capital projects and improve operations. For over twenty years we have applied unique LEAN methodologies throughout the project life cycle continually finding ways to do things better and more efficiently delivering higher quality and controlling costs. Headquartered in Blue Bell PA IPS is a multi- national company with over 1000 professionals worldwide and offices in California Indiana Kansas Massachusetts New Jersey North Carolina Pennsylvania Brazil Canada China Singapore Switzerland UK and four locations in India. Visit our website at www.ipsdb.com.'
column10: b'Basic Function IPS is hiring! We are looking for a talented IT Intern to join our industry leading Information Technology (IT) team located out of our state of the art corporate headquarters in Blue Bell PA. The IT Intern is responsible for helping to resolve a variety of high volume end-user support requests which come in via the IPS call management system telephone calls or direct communications. Activities will include but are not limited to; staging / installation / maintenance of equipment such as PC\xe2\x80\x99s and hardware performance testing / tuning of equipment and operating systems creation / maintenance of user accounts administration and troubleshooting of devices and documentation of technical solutions. Job Duties and Responsibilities \xe2\x80\xa2 Apply standard images configurations and updates to computers for deployment or problem resolution. \xe2\x80\xa2 Monitor Desktop support issues and handle / triage calls through to resolution. If unable to resolve assign issues to the appropriate escalation group while thoroughly and accurately documenting each step as well as the results of the troubleshooting process. \xe2\x80\xa2 Direct or remote installation / configuration of standard or approved desktop hardware and software such as Microsoft Office / Project / Visio Adobe products etc. \xe2\x80\xa2 Participate as requested as part of the IPS technical team. \xe2\x80\xa2 Assist in the creation and maintenance of technical troubleshooting and support documentation. \xe2\x80\xa2 Perform maintenance and proactively check corporate conference room audio / visual communication and presentation equipment. \xe2\x80\xa2 Document systems changes workflow (Help Desk tickets) and reoccurring issues for data and audio systems. \xe2\x80\xa2 Maintain asset database as required. \xe2\x80\xa2 Special projects as assigned.'
column15: b'Qualifications & Requirements \xe2\x80\xa2 Knowledge of Windows Operating Systems particularly Windows 10. \xe2\x80\xa2 Enrolled in a College degree program or equivalent work experience in the IT field. \xe2\x80\xa2 Aptitude to learn and apply new hardware or software technologies. \xe2\x80\xa2 Detail oriented with strong organization and time management skills. \xe2\x80\xa2 Strong verbal and written communication skills with the ability to obtain information for diagnosing problems quickly and effectively. \xe2\x80\xa2 Self-motivated individual who takes both initiative and accepts responsibility for actions (i.e. thinking and going beyond the current assigned tasks). \xe2\x80\xa2 CAD or Design Software experience is a plus.'

column1: Sanofi (119090) Hiring Office Location: Cambridge
column3: Computational Biology Modeler/Scientific Computing Co-Op/Intern/ Bridgewater NJ
column9: b'Sanofi is a global healthcare leader focused on patients\xe2\x80\x99 needs engaged in the research development manufacturing and marketing of innovative therapeutic solutions. Sanofi has core strengths in healthcare with 7 growth platforms: diabetes solutions human vaccines innovative drugs consumer healthcare emerging markets animal health and the new Genzyme. At the Sanofi Group our determination inspires us to work tirelessly to make a difference in people\xe2\x80\x99s lives every day as we continually strive to create a future where everyone has access to groundbreaking medicines and healthcare. Department Description: The position is supported by the Translational Informatics (TI) department at Sanofi a global health care and pharmaceutical company. TI focuses on modeling and simulation approaches that facilitate critical decision making throughout the various phases of drug development. New paradigms for the discovery and development of novel therapeutic agents very much rely on quantitative relationships that define our understanding of disease biology the natural history of disease progression drug kinetics and dynamics and the impact of drug therapy on clinical outcomes. Models that express these relationships are useful in decision making and the development of hierarchical models that extend from systems biology though disease progression are essential in projecting the clinical success of therapeutic candidates. The IPP initiative reflects Sanofi\xe2\x80\x99s investment in quantitative sciences as well as the necessity to develop strong interdisciplinary teams with expertise in mathematics pharmacology statistics engineering bioinformatics and medicine to solve complex biological problems.'
column10: b'Responsibilities: The candidate working with Sanofi systems pharmacology and modeling scientists will enable the development of systems pharmacology and modeling platforms in a variety of disease areas including cardiovascular immunology immune-oncology and rare diseases. The individual will primarily be involved with scientific computing activities enabling the development and implementation of models and model- based tools. Responsibilities include (1) designing and building visualization environments for ongoing projects that facilitate the use of computational models for simulation purposes (2) developing algorithms and automating redundant processes to facilitate data integration aggregation and formatting for use in model building and visualization efforts (3) developing data science approaches to integrate and extract novel insights from data (4) prototyping models to facilitate the model development stage (5) running simulations using existing model platforms based on project team needs (6) maintaining modeling platforms and tool libraries. These responsibilities will be essential to ensure that modeling meets the strategic needs of the project team.'
column15: b'Basic qualifications: -Must be currently enrolled as a Drexel student with plans to return to school after the assignment -Working towards a degree in Biological Sciences Biomedical Engineering Computer Science Electrical Engineering Chemical Engineering Computer Engineering Mathematics Mechanical Engineering Health/Information Systems or related field - Experience in a variety of programming languages and strong programming principles (e.g. MATLAB R PHP HTML/XML C/C++ Mathematica and excellent working knowledge of Linux and Windows environments web servers object oriented programming) - Knowledge of basic computer architecture and client- server systems - Knowledge of scientific computing principles and IEEE standards. - Data science and computational experience Preferred qualifications: -Able to work independently and in collaboration with others -Strong organizational skills attention to detail and analytical skills -Strong written verbal and interpersonal communication skills -Desire to work within a team environment. Strong organization time management and follow-up.'
column17: b'Intermediate - Some related work or volunteer experience/second Co-op or Advanced - Previous related work experience/final Co-op'

column1: PJM Interconnection LLC (4021) Hiring Office Location: Norristown PA (1)
column8: b'Company Description: PJM Interconnection is a regional transmission organization (RTO) that plays a vital role in the U.S. electric system. PJM ensures the reliability of the largest centrally dispatched control area in North America by coordinating the movement of electricity in all or parts of 13 states. PJM acting neutrally and independently operates the largest competitive wholesale electricity market in the world. PJM manages a sophisticated regional planning process for generation and transmission expansion to assure future electric reliability. PJM facilitates a collaborative stakeholder process. Stakeholders include participants that produce buy sell move and regulate electricity. Department Description: The Facilities Department provides overall facilities management services as well as physical site engineering design building systems construction and equipment installation services for the Company. The department is responsible for maintaining reliable operation of all electrical mechanical and fire protection systems and also maintains certain control and communications systems used in mission critical dispatch operations. Additionally the department performs property management and building maintenance services for the Service Center Control Center Business Center Technology Center Learning Center and Power Facility and is responsible for coordinating the company safety program. The department also participates in supporting the Company\xe2\x80\x99s business continuity/resumption program.'
column9: b'Position Narrative: The departments responsibilities create a significant amount of procurement related activities architectural drawings and supporting technical documentation. Procurement related activities include requisition documentation purchase order recording status reports and project purchase expense analysis. The Co-op will prepare reports for these activities utilizing SAP Application provided data. The architectural drawings require organization stamping and hard copy filing. In addition drawing location tables are maintained in a Microsoft Access database. The Co-op will maintain and update this data and hard copy records. Facilities related billing information is cataloged developed and entered into Microsoft Excel spreadsheets. It is the responsibility of the Co-op position to develop and enter the spreadsheet information. There is also periodic hard copy filing emergency call out lists roster development and labeling performed by this position. Additionally there are periodic facilitiesexpense analysis that must be conducted such as electric water utility billing and maintenance vendor expenses. Please note that this session runs from 9/24/2018 until 3/29/2019. If you cannot commit to employment for the session in its entirety and/or need to end the session earlier than the end date of 3/29/2019 please DO NOT apply.'

column15: b'Who are we looking for: -Must possess a desire to learn a drive to improve and a natural curiosity about how things work and why things are done in a certain way. -Self-motivated passionate technical professional able to provide realistic time estimates and driven to achieve committed milestones. -Microsoft .NET experience (VB.NET ASP.NET C#). -Solid understanding of Object-Oriented Design and Analysis multi-threading and SQL Server database programming a plus. -Develop test and debug code in an agile environment. -Develop maintain and troubleshoot software solutions for new and existing products. -Communicate with both technical and non-technical groups on a regular basis to pass along important information and to ensure the design and implementation details conform to requirements. -Demonstrable technical problem solving skills. column9: b'The Academic Center for Engineers (ACE) provides students in the College of Engineering support in the form of one-on-one and small group tutoring to succeed at Drexel University. Over the past five years ACE has grown from supporting 3 courses with 4 tutors to supporting 35 courses and employing more than 20 tutors each term. ACE has poised itself to become a model tutoring center for other departments and colleges at Drexel University. Our approach is to \xe2\x80\xa2 Staff the Academic Center for Engineers with tutors who demonstrate exemplary academic ability and a pragmatic approach to problem solving \xe2\x80\xa2 Create walk-in hours tailored to student availability \xe2\x80\xa2 Serve students on a first-come first-served basis during walk-in hours \xe2\x80\xa2 Provide appointment-based tutoring \xe2\x80\xa2 Adapt accordingly to student and instructor feedback In academic terms to come the Academic Center for Engineers will be working toward retention goals which also aligns with the future direction of the College of Engineering. ACE exists under the Associate Director of Assessment & Retention Projects for the College of Engineering.'

column8: b'The SAP Innovation Center Silicon Valley is looking for students with a passion for software engineering and who love to create amazing things. We are an interdisciplinary team with skills and experiences ranging from architecture consulting data science visual & interaction design to engineering and we are looking for energetic students and graduates who want to join our team. If you are highly motivated and excited to work in a dynamic environment with changing tasks and responsibilities brainstorming far away visions creating beautiful software based on challenging requirements and tight timelines without much support due to the complexity of the technologies we interact with then we are looking for you. We would be delighted to hear about the projects that you have worked on so far - impress us by sharing concepts photos screenshots videos code fragments of highlights of your work and e.g. your GitHub profile. The scope includes modifying and enhancing the Infor Syteline ERP platform as well as other enterprise systems. \xe2\x80\xa2 Enhance software to reduce operating time or improve efficiency. \xe2\x80\xa2 Accountable for the assessment and optimization of software design through review and analysis of user needs. \xe2\x80\xa2 Maintain proper documentation develop requests for proposals evaluate vendor products and make recommendations on selection. \xe2\x80\xa2 Analyze and understand business functional requirements to develop technical specifications and design \xe2\x80\xa2 Develop ERP system enhancements and applications to enhance and promote efficiency within environments. \xe2\x80\xa2 Develop solutions utilizing current Microsoft and Infor Syteline development tools \xe2\x80\xa2 Establish and maintain a thorough understanding of the Infor Syteline ERP system \xe2\x80\xa2 Utilize modern development practices and methodologies while suggesting process improvements \xe2\x80\xa2 Ensure that software design promotes modularity and portability is reliable serviceable maintainable has demonstrable accuracy privacy and security and is sufficient within the parameters of the system. \xe2\x80\xa2 Test new programs to ensure that logic and syntax are correct and that program results are accurate. Ensure issues are identified tracked reported on and resolved in a timely manner.'

column1: Susquehanna Int'l Group LLP (4792) Hiring Office Location: Bala Cynwyd
column9: b'SIG is a global quantitative trading firm founded with an entrepreneurial mindset and a rigorous analytical approach to decision making. We commit our own capital to trade financial products around the world. With experts in almost every discipline we build some of the most powerful trading systems in the financial industry. By integrating sophisticated coding techniques with innovative engineering ideas we design and optimize systems that can process massive amounts of data while still ensuring high performance and stability. Working with traders and quants our systems engineers network architects technical analysts and software developers create industry-leading technical solutions. Our over 750 technologists are quick-thinking open- minded able to execute on ideas and committed to innovation. We use an iterative and agile approach testing and improving our ideas along the way. Our engineers and developers focus on the entire technology stack always with an eye towards evolving a stable scalable optimized technology environment with minimized risk. Being at SIG has its perks: \xe2\x80\xa2 Relaxed dress code: jeans and sneakers are the norm \xe2\x80\xa2 Food beverages and snacks available all day \xe2\x80\xa2 Game room with golf simulators game tables (poker pool ping pong etc.) multicade classics video games and Play Station/X-Box video area \xe2\x80\xa2 A 9000 square-foot gym with cardio cross fit and strength machines plus yoga and indoor cycling classes \xe2\x80\xa2 Discounts for dining entertainment shopping travel and attractions \xe2\x80\xa2 Social events such as a poker tournament and holiday party \xe2\x80\xa2 On-site services such as dry cleaning/ laundry and auto repair/detailing \xe2\x80\xa2 Free parking and easily accessible via public transportation'
column10: b'At SIG we understand that technology is critical to the success of our business. In this role you will get to work with the latest technologies in our multi-vendor enterprise environment consisting of more than 6800 servers. You will gain both knowledge and hands on experience across our diverse infrastructure through interactions with our Windows Linux Virtual and Storage teams. This will include building maintaining and troubleshooting our physical and virtual systems through a combination of third party and internally developed tools. You will also partner with our engineering development and business teams to test new solutions in our lab and validate production server requests to ensure we are meetings the needs of the teams we support. This role offers broad exposure across several disciplines which fosters multiple opportunities for growth within and across our firm. What You\xe2\x80\x99ll Get to Do: \xe2\x80\xa2 Support our complex enterprise systems infrastructure trading applications database teams and/or developer groups by diagnosing systems problems recommending solutions and implementing initiatives \xe2\x80\xa2 Gain hands on experience working with innovative and new hardware in our technology lab \xe2\x80\xa2 Help enhance our monitoring and management tools while working with team members to improve our current standards and policies Technology co-ops at SIG get to learn about technology in a complex environment while also gaining real world hands-on work experience. Our teams use a variety of platforms (Linux and Windows) and programming languages (primarily Python and PowerShell in this role). We hire first second and third time co-ops into many different teams where you\xe2\x80\x99ll be able to apply what you learn in class to real world scenarios.'
column15: b'\xe2\x80\xa2 Good understanding of Windows and/or Linux OS \xe2\x80\xa2 Basic scripting and programming experience \xe2\x80\xa2 Working knowledge of Dell hardware is a plus'
column17: b'Beginner - Limited or no previous work experience/first Co-op or Intermediate - Some related work or volunteer experience/second Co-op or Advanced - Previous related work experience/final Co-op'

column10: b'Do you find yourself tinkering with new technologies always wanting to learn more? What if your job allowed you to gain exposure to a broad range of the latest technologies? SIG\xe2\x80\x99s Data Center team is responsible for managing our two onsite data centers which span more than 12000 square feet combined and consist of over 6000 multi-vendor devices. This team is responsible for ensuring our business critical systems are operating at high performance while remaining stable. Reasons to Join SIG\xe2\x80\x99s Data Center Team: \xe2\x80\xa2 We\xe2\x80\x99re not your \xe2\x80\x9cone size fits all\xe2\x80\x9d shop. This role offers exposure to a variety of hardware and software across our multi-vendor enterprise environment. No need to limit your experience. You will get to work across our Windows Linux network security and facilities systems. \xe2\x80\xa2 We like to mix it up. Your role will require a mixture of monitoring critical systems building and deploying servers data center planning and infrastructure testing. Working on server builds and deployments offers the opportunity to deploy and configure high performance server hardware in custom configurations of both Windows and Linux. Production monitoring and troubleshooting is another primary area of focus and will involve hands on work at all levels of the production environment. \xe2\x80\xa2Your success is our success. We work with you to help you build your skills in a variety of different areas. As part of the learning process there will also be opportunities to visit other SIG Data Centers located within the regional area. You must be willing to maintain a flexible schedule in order to be able to participate in hands on Data Center work that takes place after the market closes (8AM- 4:30PM or possibly assisting the second shift 1:30-9:30PM).'
column15: b'\xe2\x80\xa2 Knowledge of Linux (Sles 11/12) preferred \xe2\x80\xa2 Microsoft Operating systems knowledge; Windows Server 2010/12 Active Directory \xe2\x80\xa2 Experience with server and network hardware \xe2\x80\xa2 Familiar with MS Office Applications \xe2\x80\xa2 Infrastructure experience with cabling technology preferred \xe2\x80\xa2 Enterprise Toolsets experience (Backup Software Job Scheduling DCIM) \xe2\x80\xa2 Programming experience: shell Perl VB script preferred'

column10: b"Our Trading Floor Support team is committed to providing the highest level of technical support for our end-user community. Our mission is to maintain business productivity by providing highly effective customer service and developing innovative solutions to meet the technology needs of the businesses we support. You will engage with and directly support 350 users across our dynamic business and technical environments. We don't follow a script; each day there is a new opportunity to solve a problem automate a task or kickoff a new project. You will be exposed to a wide variety of technologies which fosters multiple opportunities for growth within and across our firm. A Day in the Life of Our Trade Floor Support Team: \xe2\x80\xa2 We\xe2\x80\x99re responsible for putting out fires on the trade floor. This ranges from preventative maintenance compatibility testing and troubleshooting hardware and software. We have to think quick to get a solution place but also have the opportunity to research test and build out longer term solutions to ensure our users aren\xe2\x80\x99t encountering the same issues again and again. \xe2\x80\xa2 We partner with the business and technology teams. You will not be required to escalate issues off to another team but will instead partner with those teams to ensure we are resolving issues for our users as quickly and effectively as possible. \xe2\x80\xa2 Our team works in a fast-paced environment that requires us to constantly be thinking of ways to minimize our workload and maximizing our performance. We have the freedom to develop tools and automation to benefit the needs of our team. \xe2\x80\xa2 We stay on our toes and keep busy. You will have plenty of opportunity to get out from behind your desk whether it\xe2\x80\x99s replacing hardware moving workstations or following up with a user to make sure the solution we provided is working for them. \xe2\x80\xa2 One of the most interesting parts of our role is the exposure we gain. Working on the trade floor means we get to experiment with cutting-edge technologies including testing prototype hardware in the trading environment."
column15: b'\xe2\x80\xa2 Proficient in Microsoft Office suite specifically Excel \xe2\x80\xa2 Microsoft Windows 7/10 Server 2008/2012 Active Directory preferred \xe2\x80\xa2 Programming in PowerShell Python C# or VB script a plus \xe2\x80\xa2 Experience troubleshooting and repairing computer hardware'

column10: b'Our Global User Support team is committed to providing the highest level of technical support for our end-user community. Our mission is to maintain business productivity by providing highly effective and quality customer service to meet the technology needs of the businesses we support. You will engage with and directly support over 800 users across our dynamic business and technical environments. You will not only be responsible for resolving technical issues as they arise but will also be heavily involved in projects to prevent these problems from occurring in the first place. This role offers exposure to a wide variety of technologies which fosters multiple opportunities for growth. We\xe2\x80\x99re Not Your Typical Help Desk: \xe2\x80\xa2 We\xe2\x80\x99re not a call center. Our end users can contact our team directly by phone email IM or even stop by our office. We don\xe2\x80\x99t outsource our support so regardless of how users contact us they can be assured we will have the access and knowledge necessary to help them. \xe2\x80\xa2 We think proactively not reactively. Our goal is to find potential issues before they ever reach our user base. We are involved in preventative maintenance compatibility testing and research of new technologies to ensure we understand how changes will affect our environment before those technologies are implemented. \xe2\x80\xa2 We\xe2\x80\x99re not confined to \xe2\x80\x9ctiers\xe2\x80\x9d. We work with just about every team across our organization. The technical knowledge of the users we support varies and so does the complexity of the challenges we encounter. We are given the flexibility and resources we need to ensure we can solve whatever problem is thrown our way. \xe2\x80\xa2 Continual growth opportunities. Whether it\xe2\x80\x99s querying databases automating a task learning PowerShell or taking on a new project we never want our team members to stop developing. We encourage growth both within the role and across our firm.'

Being at SIG has its perks: \xe2\x80\xa2 Relaxed dress code: jeans and sneakers are the norm \xe2\x80\xa2 Food beverages and snacks available all day \xe2\x80\xa2 Game room with golf simulators game tables (poker pool ping pong etc.) multicade classics video games and Play Station/X-Box video area \xe2\x80\xa2 A 9000 square-foot gym with cardio cross fit and strength machines plus yoga and indoor cycling classes \xe2\x80\xa2 Discounts for dining entertainment shopping travel and attractions \xe2\x80\xa2 Social events such as a poker tournament and holiday party \xe2\x80\xa2 On-site services such as dry cleaning/ laundry and auto repair/detailing \xe2\x80\xa2 Free parking and easily accessible via public transportation'
column10: b'As a monitoring management and automation products and practices (MMAPP) co-op you will have an opportunity to use maintain support and improve our enterprise monitoring management and automation systems. As part of our MMAPP team you will learn our enterprise monitoring management and automation systems and techniques and participate in key areas including server operations server monitoring network operations network device monitoring server provisioning device discovery and inventory job scheduling troubleshooting big data mining and general support. Your specific responsibilities will include: \xe2\x80\xa2 Support of our enterprise monitoring operations o Discovery of server and network devices o Troubleshooting alarms and SNMP issues o Configuring and tune enterprise monitoring systems o Handling a variety of monitoring related change tickets \xe2\x80\xa2 Work closely with our Network Services team o Support the testing of network gear to include devices physical interfaces and virtual links o Ensure that network devices are properly monitored through the use of scripts utilities and manual checks o Ensure the accuracy and completeness of networking monitoring reports \xe2\x80\xa2 Work closely with our Platform Services team o Support full life cycle monitoring of servers o Ensure accurate inventory of servers through our Matrix data control process \xe2\x80\xa2 Work closely with our Server Provisioning team o Ensure the proper function of systems that configure and automate server builds \xe2\x80\xa2 Support our enterprise job scheduling solutions o Work with experts in the team to ensure proper functioning of our Tidal Enterprise Scheduler environment and associated services such as TidePool \xe2\x80\xa2 Assist in the evaluation of new monitoring and automation products and tools as necessary \xe2\x80\xa2 Collaborate with other SIG teams to design customized monitoring and automation solutions as necessary In your MMAPP Co-Op role you will work closely with members of the MMAPP team and will also work collaboratively with other technical teams from Platform Services to Enterprise User Services and Data Center Operations.'
column15: b'\xe2\x80\xa2 Experience scripting with Python / Bash / Perl / Powershell or similar scripting language \xe2\x80\xa2 Basic understanding of networking concepts \xe2\x80\xa2 Knowledge of SNMP is a plus \xe2\x80\xa2 Experience with WMI for Windows monitoring and management is a plus \xe2\x80\xa2 Knowledge of the Cisco IOS model is a plus \xe2\x80\xa2 Understanding of Windows and/or Linux systems administration a plus \xe2\x80\xa2 Experience in any enterprise monitoring tools open source or commercial is a plus'
column17: b'Beginner - Limited or no previous work experience/first Co-op or Intermediate - Some related work or volunteer experience/second Co-op or Advanced - Previous related work experience/final Co-op'

column1: Susquehanna Int'l Group LLP (4792) Hiring Office Location: Bala Cynwyd
column9: b'SIG is a global quantitative trading firm founded with an entrepreneurial mindset and a rigorous analytical approach to decision making. We commit our own capital to trade financial products around the world. With experts in almost every discipline we build some of the most powerful trading systems in the financial industry. By integrating sophisticated coding techniques with innovative engineering ideas we design and optimize systems that can process massive amounts of data while still ensuring high performance and stability. Working with traders and quants our systems engineers network architects technical analysts and software developers create industry-leading technical solutions. Our over 750 technologists are quick-thinking open-minded able to execute on ideas and committed to innovation. We use an iterative and agile approach testing and improving our ideas along the way. Our engineers and developers focus on the entire technology stack always with an eye towards evolving a stable scalable optimized technology environment with minimized risk. Being at SIG has its perks: \xe2\x80\xa2 Relaxed dress code: jeans and sneakers are the norm \xe2\x80\xa2 Food beverages and snacks available all day \xe2\x80\xa2 Game room with golf simulators game tables (poker pool ping pong etc.) multicade classics video games and Play Station/X-Box video area \xe2\x80\xa2 A 9000 square-foot gym with cardio cross fit and strength machines plus yoga and indoor cycling classes \xe2\x80\xa2 Discounts for dining entertainment shopping travel and attractions \xe2\x80\xa2 Social events such as a poker tournament and holiday party \xe2\x80\xa2 On-site services such as dry cleaning/ laundry and auto repair/detailing \xe2\x80\xa2 Free parking and easily accessible via public transportation'
column10: b'As a web development co-op you will assist one of our technology teams that is responsible for some of our internally developed and third party applications integrations websites data analysis systems and tools for monitoring/maintaining/testing/validating our trading systems. Responsibilities could include: \xe2\x80\xa2 Designing and developing new web interfaces to critical team tools \xe2\x80\xa2 Designing and developing business models involving querying databases and other data stores \xe2\x80\xa2 General support and development of team scripts databases and websites \xe2\x80\xa2 Troubleshooting client/server issues \xe2\x80\xa2 Support of application deployments at the enterprise level \xe2\x80\xa2 Monitoring status and functionality of systems and investigating identifying and resolving user and application problems Technology co-ops at SIG get to learn about technology in a complex environment while also gaining real world hands-on work experience. Our teams use a variety of platforms (Linux and Windows) and programming languages (primarily C++ C# and Python). We hire first second and third time co-ops into many different teams where you\xe2\x80\x99ll be able to apply what you learn in class to real world scenarios.'
column15: b'\xe2\x80\xa2 Willingness to learn and apply new skills while developing prototypes for a new web service \xe2\x80\xa2 Understanding the Web stack: server application database and client \xe2\x80\xa2 Experience with JavaScript (and JavaScript library e.g. JQuery or AngularJS) and Python preferred but open to other web development and scripting languages'
column17: b'Beginner - Limited or no previous work experience/first Co-op or Intermediate - Some related work or volunteer experience/second Co-op or Advanced - Previous related work experience/final Co-op'

column10: b'As a Software Developer Co-op you will assist in the development delivery and/or support of technical solutions for mission-critical proprietary and third party applications systems. Responsibilities include applying software coding and programming skills to business areas; programming/debugging applications; monitoring status and functionality of systems and investigating identifying and resolving user and application problems. Examples of past co-op projects include: \xe2\x80\xa2 Parsing incoming market data into efficient data structures and abstractions \xe2\x80\xa2 Developing and supporting applications and systems that are critical to the operations of our Commodity trading business \xe2\x80\xa2 Creating new Python/MySQL features in our reporting and calculation engine for option order routing \xe2\x80\xa2 Developing and maintaining an ASP.NET/MVC web application for monitoring our internal overnight processes and a WPF Windows application for managing deployments Technology co-ops at SIG get to learn about technology in a complex environment while also gaining real world hands-on work experience. Our teams use a variety of platforms (Linux and Windows) and programming languages (primarily C++ C# and Python). We hire first second and third time co-ops into many different teams where you\xe2\x80\x99ll be able to apply what you learn in class to real world scenarios.'

column1: Ipipeline (107046) Hiring Office Location: Exton PA (1)
column8: b'iPipeline is a leading provider of cloud-based software solutions for the life insurance industry. Through our SaaS solutions we accelerate and simplify insurance sales compliance operations and support. We provide process automation and seamless integration between every participant in the life insurance industry including carriers agents (such as financial advisors and independent insurance agents) distributors (such as banks broker-dealers and general agencies) and consumers. Our innovative solutions enable automated processing for pre-sales point-of-sale execution of applications post-sale support reporting consumer delivery and agency management. iPipeline provides the process automation and seamless integration needed on a global basis to make a sale by aggregating more than 120 carriers 875 distributors and financial institutions and their producers and licensed advisors in a cloud-based environment. With headquarters in Exton Pennsylvania iPipeline has locations in Danville Fort Lauderdale Huntersville Philadelphia Roswell Salt Lake City Tokyo Cheltenham (UK) and Vancouver. Visit us at www.ipipeline.com.'
column9: b'iPipeline is offering a unique Co-Op experience which will prepare you for the real world and stand out from your peers. Benefits of the program include: \xe2\x80\xa2Competitive Pay \xe2\x80\xa2 Stability - iPipeline is the industry leader in SaaS solutions for insurance \xe2\x80\xa2Growth - We are growing quickly and well capitalized to continue growing (backed by Technology Crossover Ventures (TCV) Volition Capital and NewSpring Capital) \xe2\x80\xa2Teamwork \xe2\x80\x93 We currently employ over 500 globally (US Canada UK andJapan) \xe2\x80\xa2Creativity - We empower our employees to "think outside the box" \xe2\x80\xa2Innovation - iPipeline strives to deliver cutting edge solutions \xe2\x80\xa2FUN! - We sponsor a multitude of different extracurricular activities The Co-Op Developer will be working with a team responsible for implementing e-commerce systems for our customers. The Developer will get experience in delivering end-to-end solutions maintaining quality and delivering on time. Candidates must possess the ability to excel in a team environment in which strong collaboration and high work ethic is essential. If you\'re a capable and ambitious web developer with a self-start problem-solving attitude and want to have success in a fast-paced environment you could be an ideal fit for this position. Tools/Technologies we use: HTML 5 C# Objective C JSON JQuery Mobile WCF Visual Studio Xcode Responsive Design & Development Distributed Caching Enterprise Message Bus. What our Co-Ops have said about their experience at iPipeline: \xe2\x80\x9cI felt I was always busy whether it was one project that took me several hours or several different projects. My mentor kept me involved with his project work therefore I was always learning.\xe2\x80\x9d \xe2\x80\x9ciPipeline has given me the opportunity to get real life experience in the career path I am choosing. Not only do I enjoy my work I enjoy the people I work with. Everyone is extremely helpful and it\xe2\x80\x99s simply one of the best companies to experience the role as a developer.\xe2\x80\x9d \xe2\x80\x9cThe intern program has taught me more than I would ever learn in a classroom and you become a vital part of a project team experience that is invaluable.\xe2\x80\x9d \xe2\x80\x9cI rarely had downtime. My mentor always had a bunch of work for me to do. I was continuously delegated new tasks but not at a rate I could not handle. If there was a lot given to me my mentor worked with me to complete it.\xe2\x80\x9d'

column1: PricewaterhouseCoopers LLP (4086) Hiring Office Location: Philadelphia PA (1)
column2: PwC Risk Assurance - IAS/PA Co-Op Fall 2019 - NEW YORK CITY
column8: b"Risk Assurance - Thriving on change Today's business environment is different. More complex. More connected. Companies face new and unknown risks but also new and untapped opportunities. Risk Assurance is at the forefront of this change ready to transform how you perceive - and capitalize on - risk."
column9: b"To be eligible for this position you must also apply to: http://pwc.cm/tp/rj6_kU93e_J-K Line of Service: Assurance Job Type: Full Time Travel Requirements: 0-20% Office Locations: New York Job ID: 106989BR Level: Intern CS Co-Op will occur approx August 2019 - December 2019. PwC/LOS Overview PwC is a network of firms committed to delivering quality in assurance tax and advisory services. We help resolve complex issues for our clients and identify opportunities. Learn more about us at www.pwc.com/us. At PwC we develop leaders at all levels. The distinctive leadership framework we call the PwC Professional (http://pwc.to/pwcpro) provides our people with a road map to grow their skills and build their careers. Our approach to ongoing development shapes employees into leaders no matter the role or job title. Are you ready to build a career in a rapidly changing world? Developing as a PwC Professional means that you will be ready - to create and capture opportunities to advance your career and fulfill your potential. To learn more visit us at www.pwc.com/careers. What will you do if you work in Assurance at PwC? You'll ask questions and test assumptions. You'll help determine if companies are reporting information that investors and others can rely on. You'll help businesses solve complex issues faced by management and boards. You'll serve the public interest and the capital markets by conducting quality audits. Visit http://pwc.to/pwcassurance for more information on PwC's Assurance practice. The world is quickly changing that's why PwC is quickly adapting. We're capitalizing on trends that will impact corporate reporting. Our focus is on globalization technology sustainability and environmental reporting population shifts and regulation. We combine skills and experience to help our clients address their challenges. Under the Assurance umbrella the Risk Assurance practice encompasses solutions that are driven by dynamic global markets which require companies to take actions to successfully address business risks and opportunities. Our professionals work across sectors and develop deep competencies which allow them to advise both audit and non-audit clients. Practitioners are thought leaders in developing innovative responses to a changing risk environment in areas such as Compliance Reporting Internal Audit and Data Analytics. Risk Assurance has 3700+ professionals in the US who deliver quality audits and advise companies about how to solve complex problems and take advantage of new business opportunities. Risk Assurance solutions are aligned around the following risk management and mitigation areas: - Design and operating effectiveness of internal control framework - Internal Audit program Effectiveness - Governance Risk and Compliance Program Effectiveness - Strategic Data and Technology Initiatives Professionals serve both public and private companies across 13 key industries. We help companies achieve the confidence needed for strong three lines of defense on risk by: - Building and fortifying internal and IT risk controls - Developing and strengthening risk and compliance programs - Improving the capabilities of Internal Audit function We draw proudly on our auditing heritage as well as our commercial experience to rigorously evaluate and implement a company\xc3\xa2\xe2\x82\xac\xe2\x84\xa2s governance procedures processes information and controls. We provide broad support across a business to elevate trust and transparency protect the business and give all parties assurance that risks are fully anticipated understood and managed strategically."
column10: b'No'
column13: b"Minimum Academic Requirements: Pursuing a Bachelor's degree in Accounting Finance/Economics Management Information Systems Computer Science Business Administration Statistics Mathematics Regulatory Compliance Science Technology Engineering and Mathematics and/or other business field of study. Preferred cumulative GPA: 3.3 Preferred Major GPA: 3.3 Eligible students should be in the 3rd year of a 4 yr degree program or in the 4th year of a 5yr program. Client service interns typically join us during the winter/spring or summer prior to their intended graduation year. Job Duties: Play a role as an intern in PwC's Risk Assurance practice assisting with the development of risk assessments and audit plans; assisting in the execution of internal controls internal and external audit support fieldwork or Sarbanes-Oxley. Participate in select portions of internal controls and/or internal/external audits. Participate in projects demonstrating creative thinking and individual initiative. Cultivate teamwork dynamics through working as a team member: understanding personal and team roles; contributing to a positive working environment by building solid relationships with team members; and proactively seeking guidance clarification and feedback. Demonstrate flexibility in prioritizing and completing tasks; and communicating potential conflicts to a supervisor. Exercise professional skepticism in gathering reviewing and analyzing client information. Job Requirements: Demonstrates some knowledge of and/or proven record of success through experience or coursework in the broad range of risks affecting companies and management decision making complex IT environments and/or all aspects of auditing including in the following areas: - Desire to pursue a career in Public Accounting; - Basic understanding of one or more of the following: application controls IT general controls financial reporting concepts and the internal and/or external audit process; - Experience demonstrating strong problem solving skills and the ability to prioritize and handle multiple tasks; - Ability to interact with various levels of client and firm management in both written and verbal form; and - Flexibility and desire to travel as client assignments require. Wonder what its really like to be an intern in risk assurance? Hear from PwC people doing it right now! https://youtu.be/CMLWBreZshY"

column10: b'1.Manage a help desk team consisting of multiple part-time student assistants to ensure that all tickets and tasks are documented communicated to other shifts and completed in a timely manner. 2. Train and supervise student assistants as appropriate. 3. Organize and lead projects assigned by your supervisor to completion by delegating tasks to student assistants. 4. Escalate appropriate tickets to full-time IT staff that cannot be completed by yourself or your team. 5. Maintain extremely high level of customer service when dealing with and responding to not only users but students as well. 6. Conduct and facilitate bi-weekly team meetings where team/help desk issues are addressed. 7. Perform advanced software and hardware troubleshooting for computers. 8. Organize and implement self-driven projects that will make the school better for its students and faculty. 9. Administer a Windows domain consisting of a 2012 domain controller System Center Essentials 2010 server file server and 100 client computers. MINIMUM JOB REQUIREMENTS: At least one year of experience related to responsibilities outlined above in addition to experience with duties related to help desk positions. KNOWLEDGE SKILLS AND QUALITIES REQUIRED: A strong background with customer service and help desk positions. You must be highly self-motivated and be able to work independently of your supervisor to create and complete new projects as well as resolve issues that you aren\xe2\x80\x99t familiar with. You must leverage the strengths and weaknesses of your team members in order to delegate them to issues they can resolve quickly. In addition you must have strong organizational skills to ensure that each shift of student assistants properly communicates incomplete/scheduled tasks with the entire team. A strong willingness to learn quickly as well as experience with Windows Server Server 2012 Active Directory Group Policy Management VMware ESXi WSUS and SCCM is highly desirable.'

column9: b'The Entrepreneurial Game Studio (EGS) is a faculty-led game development studio that focuses on the professional development and mentorship of Philadelphia\xe2\x80\x99s next generation of technology and entertainment professionals. EGS is located within the Expressive and Creative Interaction Technologies (ExCITe) Center. ExCITe works to support connect and inspire transdisciplinary research and learning in the service of advancing technology and community. Established in 2013 as a University-wide strategic initiative for research innovation the ExCITe Center houses three faculty research labs three digital inclusion initiatives and six student organizations at the intersection of design technology and entrepreneurship.'
column10: b'EGS is looking for an independent self-starter that is eager to both gain administrative skills and exercise their creative chops in the field of game design. In the past EGS Co-ops have taken major roles in the creative development of projects with industry partners and national funding agencies contributing in many cases to both the design and development of games. In addition to any creative work the EGS Co-op is responsible for coordinating and leading weekly meetings with the lab\xe2\x80\x99s large student group. This may include scheduling guest speakers arranging talks to be given by students in the lab and any administrative work related to maintaining a thriving lab community. Regular Tasks Include: - Publishing a weekly lab-wide newsletter - Scheduling guest speakers - Running weekly student lab meetings - Maintaining the physical lab space - Contributing creatively to funded research projects - Performing written research - Creating or contributing to playable game prototypes'
