column1: Drexel University (1874) Hiring Office Location: Philadelphia
column3: Privacy Security and Automation Lab Research Assistant A / Philadelphia PA
column9: b'Drexel University Computer Science Department Privacy Security and Automation Lab (psal.cs.drexel.edu)'
column10: b'Join the Privacy Security and Automation Lab and work on the Adversarial Stylometry Project. Today attribution of malware and cyberattacks is difficult and often impossible. It either requires painstaking manual analysis by an handful of individuals with detailed knowledge of adversarial tools and reversing skills or makes use of sensitive sources and methods that cannot be released to the public or other partners. At the same time Source code authorship attribution is a significant privacy threat to anonymous code contributors. We plan to take advantage of recent breakthroughs made by our team in attributing code and binaries to programmers. These breakthroughs stem from the realization that individual programmer style can often be captured in the structures programmers use via the Abstract Syntax Tree which can be represented in feature vectors and then used by classification algorithms such as random forests. Including these features allows us to improve the accuracy and scale of attribution approaches by an order of magnitude. This research has been featured in the Register https://www.theregister.co.uk/2018/03/16/identifying_ano nymous_prog rammers/ by Bruce Schneier https://www.schneier.com/blog/archives/2016/01/de- anonymizing_.html and at Hacker conferences like CCC https://media.ccc.de/v/32c3-7491-de- anonymizing_programmers. The research student will work with Dr. Rachel Greenstadt and a team of graduate students to design and run experiments to test whether and how people can hide their coding style from machine learning systems. We will also explore using these techniques to discover the authors of malware. The student will likely participate in authoring an academic paper (previous coop students have had work published) and have the opportunity to travel to conferences and research meetings. The direction of the project is flexible based on the skills and interests of the student(s) selected.'
column15: b'Programming experience. Experience with Visual Basic C/C++ malware or machine learning a plus but not required.'

column8: b'Philadelphia Water Department is a municipal department with approximately 2500 employees which provides water and wastewater treatment and services for the City of Philadelphia and some surrounding counties.'
column9: b'The role of the Philadelphia Water Department\xe2\x80\x99s Data Analysis and Planning group includes programmatic planning compliance reporting data analysis and program support for PWD\xe2\x80\x99s 25-year multi-billion- dollar Green City Clean Waters Program. This ambitious program seeks to modernize Philadelphia\xe2\x80\x99s approach to stormwater management by focusing resources on green infrastructure strategies for reducing combined sewer overflows and improving water quality. For more information please see http://www.phillywatersheds.org. A significant component of Data Analysis & Planning\xe2\x80\x99s work is focused on maintaining processing and analyzing a wealth of spatial data associated with green stormwater infrastructure. The candidate selected will assist the GIS Specialist with editing and mapping data providing valuable input for developing replicable geoprocessing models and thoroughly documenting procedures. As a GIS co-op in the Data Analysis and Planning group you will receive first-hand experience in managing and maintaining critical datasets that contribute toward the implementation of a nationally recognized stormwater program. You will be responsible for analysis and support of the largest green infrastructure dataset in the world. This opportunity provides an environment to practice and grow your technical skill set and will expose you to numerous forms of cartographic resources. You will also learn how a large city coordinates and shares data across multiple departments by meeting with other GIS professionals across the City. Typical tasks and responsibilities include: - Editing spatial datasets - Assisting in crafting methodologies and executing analyses - Documenting methodologies and resources associated with specific analyses - Running routine updates - Attending internal and interdepartmental GIS professional user meetings'

column9: b"The Construction and Engineering Global Business Unit (C&E GBU) of Oracle is the world's leading project and portfolio management software organization. Since 1983 we have provided the software foundation that enables all types of businesses to achieve excellence in managing their portfolios programs projects and resources. Our software has been used to manage such projects as the Hubble Telescope Three Gorges Dam Disney's Animal Kingdom and Air Force One. It is estimated that over $6 trillion in projects have been managed with our products. The development group in the C&E GBU is focused on developing enterprise level solutions for our customers in project intensive industries. Our applications provide project and portfolio management contract management resource management and risk management solutions used by customers worldwide. We leverage Agile development methods to facilitate the development of our products. Our development practices include empowered teams continuous build and integration regular reviews and a heavy emphasis on testing early and often. We offer a highly collaborative and dynamic environment as well as a great mix of project management and software engineering opportunities. We value our employees and emphasize training keeping employees up to speed with the latest technologies. We provide flexible career paths for employees and encourage promotions from within the company."

column8: b"The Est\xc3\xa9e Lauder Companies Inc. is one of the world's leading manufacturers and marketers of quality skin care makeup fragrance and hair care products. Northtec LLC also supplies the world with Estee Lauder's leading brands of loose power and fragrance loose powder product line requirements."
column9: b'All Majors Welcome! Estee Lauder Companies Inc. located in Bucks County PA is looking for interns to support the manufacturing operations function. This position is seeking candidates interested in a leadership management and personal development experience. Candidates will be responsible for the supervising operations meeting quality standards compliance to good manufacturing practices coordinating and reporting daily and weekly results. In addition this position will facilitate team meetings provide employee training and instruction and as have the opportunity to work on special projects when needed. This position offers flexible work schedules including the potential for weekend work the chance to lead and manage multiple teams and the opportunity to develop and improve skills that are necessary for career growth in a global company. This is an excellent opportunity to learn skills that will transcend any career you pursue. You will gain valuable leadership and supervisory experience. All majors will be considered.'

column1: Bristol Myers Squibb Company (1167) Hiring Office Location: New Brunswick (1)
column8: b'Bristol-Myers Squibb is a global Biopharma company with a mission to discover develop and deliver innovative medicines that help patients prevail over serious diseases. With a commitment to our patients and customers employees global communities shareholders environment and other stakeholders we promise to act on our belief that the priceless ingredient of every product is the integrity of its maker. We operate with effective governance and high standards of ethical behavior. We seek transparency and dialogue with our stakeholders to improve our understanding of their needs. We take our commitment to economic social and environmental sustainability seriously and extend this expectation to our partners and suppliers. Business Insights & Analytics (BIA) is a cross-functional global analytics team that supports Commercial Corporate Global Supply Chain R&D and Transparency analytics. Organizationally BIA resides in Global Business Operations and reports directly into the Chief Finance Officer.'
column9: b'The BIA team is looking for an individual who is both self- motivated organized and intellectually curious with the ability to manage defined BIA initiatives within the operations team. This includes initiating and managing meetings developing and deploying team communications and training materials synthesizing and executing ideas to enhance team engagement and strengthen knowledge sharing across the team. As a member of the team the student will have the opportunity to learn about the generation and application of insights and analytics in key business decision making. He or she will also gain exposure to a variety of analytic methodologies computer-based tools and have access to both online and in-person training. While working in BIA the student will have access to flexible summer hours an on-campus gym monthly intern meetings as well as a collaborative open office space layout. This is an excellent opportunity to gain exposure to all aspects of a pharmaceutical company\xe2\x80\x99s operation. The student will gain valuable soft skills explore new opportunities as well as gain exposure to the inner workings of a large corporation. Candidates interested in Communications Business Analytics Management Consulting Analytics and Organizational Development should apply.'

column1: University of Pennsylvania (5225) Hiring Office Location: Philadelphia
column9: b'The University of Pennsylvania the largest private employer in Philadelphia is a world renowned leader in education research and innovation. This historic Ivy League school consistently ranks among the top 10 universities in the annual U.S. News & World Report survey. Penn has 12 highly regarded schools that provide opportunities for undergraduate graduate and continuing education all influenced by Penn\xe2\x80\x99s distinctive interdisciplinary approach to scholarship and learning. Penn offers a unique working environment within the city of Philadelphia. The University is situated on a beautiful urban campus with easy access to a range of educational cultural and recreational activities. With its historical significance and landmarks lively cultural offerings and wide variety of atmospheres Philadelphia is the perfect place to call home for work and play.'
column10: b'The Department of Orthopaedic Surgery at the University of Pennsylvania is seeking a motivated and talented life scientist. The candidate will work closely with Human Motion Lab staff clinical providers and patients to perform clinical research studies. Strong interpersonal skills excellent record keeping and an aptitude to quickly solve problems are needed on a daily basis. Experience with motion capture ultrasonography and strength testing are desirable but not mandatory. The successful candidate will help drive clinically relevant research projects and analyze biomechanical data collected during these experiments. Basic computer programming skills and understanding of engineering principles are desirable but not necessary. In addition to collecting and analyzing human motion data the successful candidate will interact with potential study participants which requires strict adherence to study protocol. The successful candidate will be responsible to perform several key duties: - Engage in a professional manner with other research and clinical staff - Operate motion analysis equipment during human research study sessions - Properly handle research data and protect the confidentiality of study subjects - Process study data using commercial and custom- developed analysis software. - Keep a detailed lab notebook describing the methodologies used to develop and execute experiments. After successfully performing these key duties the successful candidate will accomplish several learning objectives: - Understand how motion analysis and ultrasonography techniques are applied to study clinical populations. - Maintain an organize study notebook that documents all events that occur throughout the course of a research project - Learn how to constructively contribute to scientific discussions and present findings to a clinical audience.'
column12: b'Other Areas of the City of Philadelphia'
column15: b'The successful candidate will have several skills and qualifications that will make them prepared to excel at this position. - Coursework in anatomy and physiology. Additional coursework in biomechanics statistics statics dynamics linear algebra and programming is desired but not required. - Exposure to clinical research populations and motion analysis is desirable. - Capability to work independently and solve most problems without help from others. Regular meetings with an advisory team will be established to support the successful candidate solve more complex and challenging problems. - Strong interpersonal and communicative skills.'
column17: b'Beginner - Limited or no previous work experience/first Co-op or Intermediate - Some related work or volunteer experience/second Co-op or Advanced - Previous related work experience/final Co-op'

column1: National Board of Medical Examiners (3578) Hiring Office Location: Philadelphia
column9: b"The NBME is an independent not-for-profit organization that provides high-quality examinations for the health professions. Protection of the health of the public through state-of-the- art assessment of health professionals is the mission of the NBME along with a major commitment to research and development in evaluation and measurement. The NBME was founded in 1915 because of the need for a voluntary nationwide examination that medical licensing authorities could accept as the standard by which to judge candidates for medical licensure. Since that time it has continued without interruption to provide high-quality examinations for this purpose and has become a model and a resource of international stature in testing methodologies and evaluation in medicine. Although the NBME's mission is centered on assessment of physicians it encompasses the spectrum of health professionals along the continuum of education training and practice and includes research in evaluation as well as development of assessment instruments."
column10: b'Work with the IT Infrastructure Services team to assist in the implementation of managed services and process improvement. In this role you will be asked to work with both Python programming and customization of the ServiceNow\xe2\x84\xa2 (software-as-a-service) IT Service Management suite. Rapid learning of ServiceNow\xe2\x84\xa2 is a key to the success of this position. \xe2\x80\xa2 Review and report on process metric data and communicate with other staff to ensure data is up to date and accurate \xe2\x80\xa2 Create and/or update data pull and analysis software in Python using REST web services \xe2\x80\xa2 Ensure ServiceNow is operating at highest levels and communicate with support staff to resolve issues \xe2\x80\xa2 Assist with the implementation of service catalog items in ServiceNow\xe2\x84\xa2 \xe2\x80\xa2 Develop dashboards of data from ServiceNow\xe2\x84\xa2 and other data sources \xe2\x80\xa2 Assist in testing customized ServiceNow\xe2\x84\xa2 functionality *Important about this position - NBME Staff work a 35 hour work week so this Co-op position will also work a 35 hour work week*'
column12: b'Other Areas of the City of Philadelphia'
column15: b'Required qualifications: \xe2\x80\xa2 Willingness to perform rapid learning of the ServiceNow software platform \xe2\x80\xa2 Software development experience \xe2\x80\xa2 Knowledge of Python \xe2\x80\xa2 Ability to gather review and analyze data \xe2\x80\xa2 Knowledge of software testing and commitment to excellence in provided solutions \xe2\x80\xa2 Ability for self-directed rapid learning of new systems and services \xe2\x80\xa2Ability to clearly communicate both verbally and with written documentation \xe2\x80\xa2 Ability to solve problems and take on task work with minimal direction \xe2\x80\xa2 Expertise in MS Excel including the creation of graphs Desired qualifications: \xe2\x80\xa2 Familiarity with the concepts of customer-focused service management and/or ITIL \xe2\x80\xa2 Experience with REST web services \xe2\x80\xa2 Experience or familiarity with ServiceNow\xe2\x84\xa2 \xe2\x80\xa2 Experience or familiarity with MS SharePoint \xe2\x80\xa2 Experience with MS Excel pivot tables'

column1: Group One Trading (2446) Hiring Office Location: Philadelphia PA (2)
column8: b'Group One Trading LP a dynamic options trading firm is actively seeking motivated individuals who work well in high-pressure environments to support our operations on the Chicago Board Options Exchange. Although knowledge of the options industry is an obvious asset we are seeking college students from a wide range of backgrounds specifically in the areas of mathematics economics physics engineering or computer science. Candidates should be comfortable working in a trading environment and possess excellent communication analytical computer problem-solving and time management skills. Successful Interns will have an opportunity to be accepted into our full-time Trading Analyst class where they will learn the intricacies of options trading and the skills needed to make a successful career in market making.'
column9: b"Group One Trading LP a dynamic options trading firm is actively seeking motivated individuals who work well in high-pressure environments to support our operations on the Chicago Board Options Exchange. Although knowledge of the options industry is an obvious asset we are seeking college students from a wide range of backgrounds specifically in the areas of mathematics economics physics engineering or computer science. Candidates should be comfortable working in a trading environment and possess excellent communication analytical computer problem-solving and time management skills. Successful Interns will have an opportunity to be accepted into our full-time Trading Analyst class where they will learn the intricacies of options trading and the skills needed to make a successful career in market making. Our training program teaches analysts the essentials of stock options trading and the skills that make for a successful career on the trading floor. Trading Analysts will be employed as option floor associates and receive a guaranteed salary during their time in the program with the expectation that 'graduates' will go on to become Junior Traders then onto highly compensated Group One Traders."
column10: b'No'
column14: b'EXPECTATIONS Keen awareness of critical situations ability to shift from fast market to slow market conditions quickly and efficiently. Anticipate the needs of traders throughout the day quick comprehension and delivery of tasks. Balance/resolve position discrepancies before opening bell; notify trading staff of unexpected position changes intra-day. Ability to filter information to trading staff by necessity; reporting pertinent information to management in a timely fashion. Interns are required to articulately voice needs of the trading staff to IT vendors clearing firm brokers/other market makers and the exchange if necessary. To be well versed with all methods of communication provided by Group One these may include but are not limited to IM telephone and email. Excellent computer skills including some programming skills. They should become fluent with both the usage and rules of all applications that provide market research theoretical/analytical data order entry applications and stock/option execution. Retention of knowledge and ability to apply past experience to current situations is critical. Excellent math probability game theory skills.'
column15: b'No Restriction'
column16: b'Intermediate - Some related work or volunteer experience/second Co-op'

column1: Turn5
column10: b'Turn 5 is one of the largest and fastest growing e-commerce retailers in the Greater Philadelphia area. Best known for our award- winning e- commerce platforms AmericanMuscle.com ExtremeTerrain.com and AmericanTrucks.com we\xe2\x80\x99ve been engaging car enthusiasts with exceptional products services and experiences since 2004. Our purpose however extends beyond selling car parts. We have a commitment to creating meaningful customer experiences at every step of their journey. Whether it\xe2\x80\x99s supplying a unique product that customizes the look and feel of their ride providing thousands of educational videos for the DIYer or leveraging user generated content to inspire even the most experienced owner we are obsessed with ensuring we reach as many like-minded gearheads across the globe.'
column11: b'The goal of this internship is to provide the candidate with experience working as a part of a data and analytics team within an eCommerce business. Reporting to the BI Analyst the Analytics Intern will assist the IT team in resolving a variety of data related requests coming from various departments. These requests may include (but are not limited to) routine and ad hoc requests for raw data extracting and loading data to and from different sources and creating data visualizations and dashboards which are to be delivered primarily via Tableau. \xe2\x80\xa2 Write SQL queries to extract and/or summarize data from various sources to answer specific business questions presented by users. \xe2\x80\xa2 Extract and load data to and from various sources. \xe2\x80\xa2 Use Tableau Desktop to create reports and dashboards with the goal of delivering meaningful and actionable insights to end users.'
column15: b'No'
column16: b'\xe2\x80\xa2 Experience working with large volumes of data specifically with regards to data cleansing formatting aggregating and summarizing \xe2\x80\xa2 Experience working with SQL and Relational Databases such as MS SQL Server Oracle MySQL etc. \xe2\x80\xa2 Analytical skills and attention to details. \xe2\x80\xa2 Proficiency in Excel. (functions pivot tables VBA etc.) \xe2\x80\xa2 Excellent oral and written communication and interpersonal skills. QUALIFICATIONS \xe2\x80\xa2 Candidates must either be currently enrolled in a four- year undergraduate program with at least 90 credit-hours completed or must have graduated within the past 6 months. \xe2\x80\xa2 Candidates must have coursework experience related to the Essential Duties and Responsibilities listed above and prior experience in a business setting is preferred.'

column10: b'The Applications and Data Services\xe2\x80\x99 (ADS) unit is comprised of a group of innovative and seasoned professionals working in a supportive and collaborative environment. column1: Sports Info Solutions (144863) Hiring Office Location: Coplay
column9: b"Company Overview: Sports Info Solutions (SIS) opened its doors back in 2002 as Baseball Info Solutions and has been on the leading edge of the advanced statistical study of sports ever since. The company\xe2\x80\x99s mission is to provide the most accurate in-depth timely baseball and football data including cutting-edge research and analysis striving to educate professional teams and the public about sports analytics. The company\xe2\x80\x99s analysts and programmers dissect data producing a variety of predictive studies and analytics including Defensive Runs Saved. Defensive Runs Saved estimates the number of runs a defender saves or costs his teams because of his ability to convert balls in play into outs defend bunts turn double plays prevent baserunner advancements and several other factors. A couple of the more recent advancements are Strike Zone Plus/Minus\xe2\x80\x94which measures the number of extra strikes drawn because of the framing tendencies of catchers pitchers batters and umpires\xe2\x80\x94and Stolen Base Red Light/Green Light\xe2\x80\x94 which predicts baserunner success rates on stolen bases against various pitcher-catcher combinations even if they have never faced each other. Likewise SIS is making exciting progress in football analytics including the creation of Independent Quarterback Rating which removes many factors outside the QB's control including drops to measure passing effectiveness."
column10: b'Position Overview: Sports Info Solutions is looking for candidates to fill a paid internship in our R&D Department in the summer and fall seasons. Ideally the candidate will be available from September - March The intern will work out of our office near Allentown PA and will assist our R&D team supporting research for publications and future products. Recent R&D interns have landed internships and full-time jobs with major league teams. The position requires a variety of skills including (but not limited to) an analytical mind computer expertise writing ability and a passion for football and baseball.'
column15: b'Qualifications Ideal candidates will possess: Familiarity with contemporary football/baseball/sports analytics and research Analytical/Mathematical ability Proficiency working in Microsoft Office programs (or equivalents) especially Excel Experience with MySQL SQL Server or similar databases. An ability to write and communicate effectively with a variety of audiences An ability to work both collaboratively and independently Experience with other statistical packages (e.g. R) programming languages (e.g. Python .NET) and/or graphical visualizations (e.g. Tableau) would be a plus'
column17: b'Intermediate - Some related work or volunteer experience/second Co-op'

column9: b'Community Voices Heard (CVH) is a member-led multi-racial organization principally women of color and low-income families in New York State that builds power to secure racial social and economic justice for all. column1: Community Voices Heard (147842) Hiring Office Location: New York
column3: Policy and Civic Engagement Intern/ NY
column9: b'Community Voices Heard (CVH) is a member-led multi-racial organization principally women of color and low-income families in New York State that builds power to secure racial social and economic justice for all. Founded in 1994 by welfare recipients in New York City working to fight unjust welfare policies we have since expanded our organization to include working on multiple issues throughout New York State. Our core organizing issues include fighting for a just social safety net good jobs and access to them truly affordable housing sustainable and resilient communities immigration reform and a participatory democracy. For more information please check out our web page at: www.cvhaction.org.'
column10: b"Community Voices Heard is seeking a Policy and Civic Engagement Intern to help advance our justice organizing in low-income communities in New York City Westchester Dutchess Orange and Rockland counties. The organization is seeking someone to join the leadership/ management team of the organization and help to bring our work to the next level. After undergoing dramatic expansion over the past year (in terms of locations membership and issues) the organization is now positioned to have an even greater impact on a broader range of policies at the local state and federal levels. CVH seeks an individual interested in bringing technical skills and expertise to the grassroots \xe2\x80\x93 someone wanting to support the development of policy from the ground up and anxious to fuse one\xe2\x80\x99s policy/ research work with ongoing direct-action organizing campaigns. This is an ideal position for individuals with experience or interest in action-oriented and participatory research methodologies. Policy and civic-engagement work will be oriented around our current organizational policy priority areas and working within CVH\xe2\x80\x99s sister 501(c)(4) organization Community Voices Heard Power to help ensure that prospective endorsed candidates align with our values and will advance the organizations campaigns. The position provides a unique opportunity to engage multiple strategies for assisting in moving campaigns forward: -Develop Policy Proposals: craft proposals for local policies and programs that support the advancement CVH\xe2\x80\x99s campaigns in low- income communities. -Support Campaigns: work with community members and organizational staff to develop and implement campaign strategy to win policy proposals at city and state levels. -Provide Training to Community Members: develop and conduct training's for community leaders on policy issues and processes. -Advocate for Change: participate in meetings with elected officials and governmental committees and help prepare community members to do the same to promote organizational policy proposals. -Work in Coalition: facilitate meetings with allies and additional stakeholders in order to advance progressive policies and programs in line with campaign goals."
column15: b'We have several offices with strong bases in the Hudson Valley and NYC. The intern would be traveling to our various offices to work closely with staff esp. field organizers and CVH/CVH Power members.'
column17: b'No Restriction'

column9: b'ABOUT MARLETTE FUNDING LLC Marlette Funding is a next generation financial services company that simplifies how consumers borrow money. column1: Drexel University (1874) Hiring Office Location: Philadelphia
column3: Data Collection & Analysis for Educational Games / Philadelphia
column9: b'The Drexel University Center for Games Artificial Intelligence and Media Systems of GAIMS Center is an interdisciplinary research center which aims at pioneering AI-based media and game design research at Drexel. The mission of the center is two-fold: (1) the research mission of GAIMS is to generate significant contributions to game-based research especially in the areas of narrative- based games adaptive media experiences artificial intelligence and machine learning. (2) the center provides an interdisciplinary research environment for training undergraduate and graduate students as well as postdocs inside of externally funded research projects. The GAIMS Center is co-directed by Jichen Zhu (Digital Media) and Santiago Onta\xc3\xb1\xc3\xb3n (Computer Science)'
column10: b'This research is part of a National Science Foundation-funded project EXP: Learning Parallel Programming Concepts Through an Adaptive Game a research collaboration between Digital Media Computer Science and the School of Education to investigate how learning concurrent and parallel programming can be facilitated through adaptive and personalized game-based learning environments. Prior to 2006 most personal computers consisted of a single central processing unit (CPU) that was responsible for executing software instructions. Today\xe2\x80\x99s computers are more likely to have multiple processors which require software engineers to develop new skills around building systems that take advantage of parallel processing. The concepts and skills associated with parallel computing are becoming a critical part of computer science education. Yet they are notoriously difficult to learn without a great deal of practice. Our research involves studying the difficulties that people have learning these concepts and design games to help them practice and improve their problem solving abilities. As we approach the beginning of the fourth and last year of the project we are at a point were working prototypes are being deployed in actual classroom environments. As a result of this large amounts of data are being collected about the interactions of students with our game prototypes which will shed light into the learning processes involved in parallel programming and into the design of educational games for undergraduate STEM education. The obtained results will be the basis for upcoming grants to take the project to the next stage We seek to hire a motivated Co-op student to help design and evaluate educational games to teach parallel and concurrent skills. The four core tasks of the project concern (1) game design and development (2) machine learning and artificial intelligence component development (3) user studies and (4) data analysis. We are looking for students that can contribute to at least one of these core tasks.'
column15: b'Interested students should be knowledgable and/or willing to learn about designing and studying games as learning environments and about how to perform user studies an/or perform analysis of the data collected during the user studies. Knowledge of interview and observation techniques computer programming basic AI and machine learning and knowledge of the Unity 3D game engine are also desirable skills for the position.'
column17: b'Intermediate - Some related work or volunteer experience/second Co-op or Advanced - Previous related work experience/final Co-op'

column1: Clarivate Analytics (Thomson Reuters) (2799) Hiring Office Location: Philadelphia PA (1)
column8: b'Clarivate Analytics clients are the trailblazers and risk takers who come up with life-changing ideas. We\xe2\x80\x99re looking for our own trailblazers to help us keep providing clients some of the world\xe2\x80\x99s most trusted brands spanning scientific and academic research patent analytics pharmaceutical and biotech intelligence and IP management. We\xe2\x80\x99re an independent owned company with a rich heritage and a bold entrepreneurial mission. If you\xe2\x80\x99re excited by the thought of helping people and organizations go from new ideas to life- changing innovations faster we\xe2\x80\x99re excited to consider you for a position at Clarivate.'
column9: b'As a junior software engineer at Clarivate Analytics (formerly Thomson Reuters) you\xe2\x80\x99ll have the opportunity to develop and maintain the customer facing applications that support the Web of Science. The Web of Science is the premier research and discovery tool highly recognized and respected by the world\xe2\x80\x99s foremost researchers and scientists. It provides researchers administrators faculty and students with quick powerful access to the world\xe2\x80\x99s leading citation database. Over 7000 of the world\xe2\x80\x99s leading universities and institutions (including Drexel) subscribe to the Web of Science. The Web of Science is the top revenue producing product in the Scientific and Academic Research (SAR) group in Clarivate Analytics. You will be deeply immersed into our diverse team of seasoned and new developers performing tasks in all phases of application development lifecycle. You will have the opportunity to enhance and improve the existing application as well as lay the ground work for the future. You will be able to partner with our product owners UX/UI designers Quality Assurance and other technology teams that support the Web of Science platform. We have just recently completed a migration to the Amazon Cloud and are looking at ways to incorporate cloud and newer technologies into our existing our development stack. In addition The Drexel Co-op Steering Committee at Clarivate Analytics is committed to the overall development of each co-op student by organizing monthly activities which include team building executive panel discussions resume/interview workshops and public speaking preparation. If you are interested in working in a challenging fast paced environment and having the world see the fruits of your labor then the Web of Science team is the place for you. 1. Under direct supervision performs any of the following tasks: \xef\x82\xa7 Design and develop software products and tools. \xef\x82\xa7 Develop formalized plans for testing code and evaluate results. \xef\x82\xa7 Prepare evaluate and maintain program documentation. \xef\x82\xa7 Report task status. \xef\x82\xa7 Meet project deliverables. \xef\x82\xa7 Participate in code reviews. \xef\x82\xa7 Fix reported bugs in new applications and existing applications. \xef\x82\xa7 Ensure adherence to all applicable coding and development standards. \xef\x82\xa7 Participate in multiple phases of the software development cycle (analysis design implementation testing and deployment). \xef\x82\xa7 Research current industry software tools and technologies.'
column10: b'No'
column14: b"Qualifications: \xef\x82\xa7 Pursuing a Bachelor's degree in Computer Science Information Systems or related IT discipline. \xef\x82\xa7 1+ years experience on Web-specific development. \xef\x82\xa7 1+ years experience demonstrated experience with Java or C++. \xef\x82\xa7 Must have a demonstrated track record of working effectively with technology and proven track record of ability to deliver complex software offerings. \xef\x82\xa7 Basic knowledge of XML and related technologies. \xef\x82\xa7 Basic knowledge of Internet web development in a Unix/Linux server environment. \xef\x82\xa7 Some prior development experience with software development lifecycle (SDLC) methodologies a plus. column9: b'PPL Electric Utilities provides electric delivery service to more than 1.4 million homes and businesses in Pennsylvania and ranks among the best utility companies in the country for customer service and reliability. column10: b'The Reliability Assurance Cooperative Associate will work under general supervision and be responsible for moderately complex reliability assurance activities in support of the North American Electric Reliability Corporation (NERC) and other federal energy regulatory requirements as they relate to the PPL Electric Utilities (PPL EU) Reliability Program. The cooperative associate will participate with the Reliability Assurance group and subject matter experts to in a variety of reliability tasks including developing best practices assessing internal controls assessing adherence identifying gaps and tracking corrective actions for the NERC Reliability Program to verify the integrity accuracy and completeness of periodic departmental reports and certifications as well as presenting material as staff meetings or training sessions. The cooperative associate will interact with various EU departments including Engineering Asset Management IT and Corporate Security to share information on NERC Standards and perform reviews of procedures controls and evidence supporting the EU NERC/FERC (Federal Energy Regulatory Commission) Reliability Program.'

column1: Publicis Health (131498) Hiring Office Location: Philadelphia
column3: Paid Search Associate Publicis Health Media/ Philadelphia PA
column9: b'About Agency Publicis Health Media (PHM) is the strategic media planning and buying agency within Publicis Health and the only global media agency solely dedicated to the health and wellness space. Our mission is to define moments along the health journey and equip people with the tools and communications they need to make healthy decisions. PHM\xe2\x80\x99s core is made up of franchise and enterprise AOR relationships with some of the largest clients in the world. We also partner with Publicis Health and Publicis Groupe creative agencies to support large client brand assignments in health and wellness. By leveraging a centralized pool of health and wellness cross channel experts we have the ability to drive business results for our clients worldwide. About Publicis Health Publicis Health is the premier global health and wellness communications network. We are one of the four solutions hubs of Publicis Groupe the third-largest advertising and media company in the world giving us unparalleled global reach. We manage top-tier agencies specializing in promoting innovative solutions in advertising medical education clinical trial program development sales and marketing digital market access and medical and scientific affairs. Our nearly 6500 employees work at 15 agency brands across 60 offices located in 10 countries. We are a connected solutions hub equipped for continual business transformation in today\xe2\x80\x99s world. We integrate services across our global offices and brands to deliver on our clients\xe2\x80\x99 needs. Each of our agencies brings a unique approach to business which makes us even stronger together. We understand the rapidly changing healthcare environment and leverage it to maximize the potential of our clients\xe2\x80\x99 brands.'
column10: b'Have you ever Googled something and wondered why some of results are sponsored ads? That\xe2\x80\x99s called paid search! As a Paid Search coop you will act as a key support resource to the paid search team. You will assist the team with campaign set up execution category research and success reporting. You will learn the basic search principles and learn how to manage a client\xe2\x80\x99s online search campaigns. You will obtain valuable experience in a channel that has become a foundational tactic of digital media. Learn how paid search fits in to a brand\xe2\x80\x99s greater marketing strategy and how insights from paid search can influence that strategy! Key Responsibilities can include: \xe2\x80\xa2 Researching keywords target audiences have utilized in search \xe2\x80\xa2 Coordinating with manager to understand clients\xe2\x80\x99 goals and client deliverables \xe2\x80\xa2 Learning and gaining an understanding of search campaign tools such as AdWords AdCenter and Marin \xe2\x80\xa2 Learning and gaining an understanding of analytics tools such as Google Analytics and Adobe SiteCatalyst \xe2\x80\xa2 Executing search related tasks \xe2\x80\xa2 Providing ongoing feedback and evaluation of campaign activity and performance \xe2\x80\xa2 Assisting in campaign structure and ad copy writing \xe2\x80\xa2 Assisting with preparing reports for clients including key metrics goals attained analysis and completed/planned activities \xe2\x80\xa2 Identifying and implementing search campaign optimizations'

column17: b'No Restriction'

We understand the rapidly changing healthcare environment and leverage it to maximize the potential of our clients\xe2\x80\x99 brands.'
column10: b'Digital Media is drastically changing consumer behavior and consumption. As a result the media buying industry is going through a revolution \xe2\x80\x93 and we are looking for data nerds optimization gurus and digital marketing wannabes to help us pave the way for the future of advertising! Programmatic Media Buying is the process of automating a media buy through a piece of software. This makes marketing smarter through algorithms machine learning and real-time optimization. The Programmatic Buying team at Publicis Health Media is dedicated to educating our clients on how technology can help achieve business goals. We are committed to the marriage of \xe2\x80\x9cman and machine\xe2\x80\x9d \xe2\x80\x93 and how technology is driving innovation in the digital media landscape. The growth of programmatic buying continues to grow year over year and will continue for the foreseeable future. In this Co-op the Digital Media Trading Associate will learn the basics of programmatic media buying pharmaceutical marketing and the advertising technology landscape at the largest healthcare buying agency in the USA. Key Responsibilities \xe2\x80\xa2 Build manage and optimize programmatic media campaigns through demand side platforms such as Google Amazon The Trade Desk and Adobe \xe2\x80\xa2 Analyze large data sets from multiple sources. Learns to monitor trends in performance and develop storytelling skills \xe2\x80\xa2 Learn about different forms of targeted advertising \xe2\x80\x93 1st Party 2nd Party & 3rd party data sets contextual and publisher direct \xe2\x80\xa2 Develop an understanding of online tracking and measurement through site pixels and javascript tags \xe2\x80\xa2 Support campaign managers in reporting analysis and tactical recommendations'
column15: b'Qualifications \xe2\x80\xa2 Passionate about digital media and the advertising landscape including ad technologies data methodologies campaign and measurement \xe2\x80\xa2 Analytical thinker who can leverage technology platforms to solve problems \xe2\x80\xa2 Strong work ethic and time management skills \xe2\x80\xa2 Resourceful and curious with a drive to learn and succeed \xe2\x80\xa2 Effective communicator \xe2\x80\xa2 Proficient in Excel and PowerPoint \xe2\x80\xa2 Detail oriented and proactive \xe2\x80\xa2 Strong writing and mathematics skills'

column1: University of Pennsylvania (5225) Hiring Office Location: Center for Biomedical Image Computing and Analytics (CBICA) (34)
column8: b"The Center for Biomedical Image Computing and Analytics (CBICA https://www.med.upenn.edu/cbica/) at the University of Pennsylvania focuses on the development and application of advanced computational and analytical techniques on biomedical images. Researchers have access to extensive computing resources to explore novel concepts in image analysis leading to scientific publications and application toward clinical progress in cancer traumatic brain injury neuro-degeneration and other pathologies. The premier software product from CBICA is the Cancer Imaging Phenomics Toolkit (CaPTk https://www.med.upenn.edu/cbica/captk/). CaPTk is a software platform incorporating multiple research projects for analysis of radiographic cancer images currently focusing on brain breast and lung cancer. One of CBICA's main goals is to translate advanced computational and analytical imaging methods to the clinic. The Center and the CaPTk software package provide forums for interactions between researchers and clinicians to facilitate the flow of ideas algorithms and data between the laboratory and the clinic."
column9: b"The Center for Biomedical Image Computing and Analytics (CBICA) at the University of Pennsylvania is looking for a software developer to contribute to the CaPTk software package. The preferred candidate will make a direct contribution to medical and scientific research. Duties: Software development in C++ applying good software development practices Documentation for fellow developers and end-users Working as part of a team and collaborating closely with researchers the developer will participate in one or more of the following projects: * Design and implementation of a user-interface and data structures to extend CaPTk's ability to select subsets of data and apply image analysis pipelines to those cases. * Design and prototype client/server communication to enable the desktop CaPTk application to launch and manage computationally demanding image analysis tasks on external servers (cloud or dedicated). * Enhancement of existing Java-based system for receiving and managing medical imaging data * Implementation or extension of image analysis algorithms and applications in C++. Learning Objectives: Professional software development in a collaborative team environment Advancing understanding and practice of software development techniques Gaining knowledge specific to image analysis"
column10: b'No'
column11: b'Other Areas of the City of Philadelphia'
column14: b'Required Skills Software development with C++ Preferred Skills Experience with User Interface design principles and practice Experience with Qt in GUI development Experience with Python Experience with Java Basic familiarity with computational techniques in medical image analysis and exposure to image processing toolkits (ITK VTK OpenCV).'
column15: b'No Restriction'

column3: Intern - University Alliances / Newtown Square PA
column9: b'SAP helps companies of all sizes and industries run better. From back office to boardroom warehouse to storefront desktop to mobile device SAP empowers people and organizations to work together more efficiently and use business insight more effectively to stay ahead of the competition. We do this by extending the availability of software across on-premise installations on-demand deployments in the cloud and on mobile devices. We believe that the power of our people products and partners unleashes growth and creates significant new value for our customers SAP and ultimately entire industries and the economy at large. Our mission is to help companies of all sizes and industries to run better. Our vision is to help the world run better. Headquartered in Waldorf Germany SAP is the market leader in enterprise application software. Founded in 1972 SAP has a rich history of innovation and growth as a true industry leader. SAP applications and services enable more than 238000 customers worldwide to operate profitably adapt continuously and grow sustainably. SAP has more than 66000 employees and sales and development locations in more than 130 countries worldwide.'
column10: b'The University Alliances Program Co-op will be responsible for coordination and tactical execution of regional deliverables. The ideal candidate should possess prior work experience a level of technical knowledge logical deductive reasoning interpersonal skills an ability to work with colleagues across North America and the confidence to manage a complex set of tasks in order to ensure successful outcomes for key SAP University Alliances initiatives. Expectations & Tasks 1. Work with the Regional Director \xe2\x80\x93 North America and the University Alliances North America team on activities which relate to communications marketing operations Web 2.0 program management curriculum content and event related support. 2. Coordinate in a matrix environment internal and external stakeholders to meet program timelines and key deliverables. 3. Support priority activities to drive program success 4. Perform post-execution analysis of program to examine results and key metrics 5. Work within the budget and time allocations for the respective activities and programs. 6. Examples of activities may include one or more of the following: \xe2\x80\xa2 Follow-up on next steps related to SAP UA meetings that requires coordination \xe2\x80\xa2 Answer preliminary inquiries from prospective members \xe2\x80\xa2 Maximize the value of online and face-to-face workshops and webinars \xe2\x80\xa2 Support key University Alliances North America program activities \xe2\x80\xa2 Research background / needs of prospective members customers and other stakeholders \xe2\x80\xa2 Follow-up with professors and contributors related to curriculum \xe2\x80\xa2 Pull data (at a co-op level) to support the Regional Director in decision support and key next steps including further list development assessment of new targets UA program participation level etc.'
column15: b'Business and IT Related Knowledge & Skills: \xe2\x80\xa2 Work experience and/or courses in one or more of the following areas: marketing communications international business operations economics \xe2\x80\xa2 Some Computer Science or IT related courses \xe2\x80\xa2 Familiarity with enterprise software market or similar business- to-business programs or activities a plus \xe2\x80\xa2 Ability to assimilate complex ideas and detailed information into well written spoken and visual \xe2\x80\xa2 communications \xe2\x80\xa2 Effective program coordination skills \xe2\x80\xa2 Ability to consistently deliver results in a high- energy \xe2\x80\xa2 environment \xe2\x80\xa2 Knowledge of Web 2.0 techniques including social media and awareness of e-mail campaign management list cultivation/management and segmentation \xe2\x80\xa2 Strong organization analytical and problem solving skills \xe2\x80\xa2 Energetic team player Educational Requirements \xe2\x80\xa2 Candidate must be enrolled in an undergraduate program and on track for a Bachelor of Science degree in business marketing communications operations economics information sciences or \xe2\x80\xa2 international business. \xe2\x80\xa2 Must be part of the Drexel co-cop program and available for 6- month assignment.'

column10: b'Position Summary: The SAP STAR Program (Student Training And Rotation) is a multi-year undergraduate rotational program that is designed to employ students over internships or co-ops with the ultimate goal being full-time employment and integration with SAP. The STAR program allows students to get hands-on experience and rotate between multiple lines of businesses such as SAP\xe2\x80\x99s Internal IT (internal IT support) Digital Business Services (software support and consulting) Enterprise Analytics (sales analytic support) Software Development and Custom Development (custom solutions for customers). There is also a potential for an international rotation. Visit sap.com/careers/starprogram to learn more.'
column15: b'Expectations and Tasks: STAR students will receive a full range of trainings including business technical and soft skills prior to entering their specific department. Selected participants are expected to commit to full-time employment when on break from the university and part-time during their academic terms. Top performers who successfully graduate from university will be well positioned for full time employment in one of the appropriate areas of the business at SAP. Graduates of the program will likely find their ideal job in the areas of software development service & support product management or consulting. Education and Qualification / Skills and Competencies: \xef\x82\xb7 Currently enrolled in a degree seeking program at a university local to the Philadelphia area \xef\x82\xb7 Pursuing a relevant Bachelor\xe2\x80\x99s degree in a STEM (science technology engineering and mathematics) field of study \xef\x82\xb7 Interested in pursuing a long term internship schedule with full-time hours while on co-op as well as part-time hours during the academic year \xef\x82\xb7 Adaptable proactive and willing to learn \xef\x82\xb7 Collaborative and team-oriented \xef\x82\xb7 Excellent communicators in English (additional languages a plus) \xef\x82\xb7 Experience in one or more programming language a plus (e. g. JAVA JavaScript C++ ABAP). \xef\x82\xb7 Participation in extracurricular activities desirable Example of projects and topics students will work on include: \xef\x82\xb7 Machine Learning \xef\x82\xb7 Big Data \xef\x82\xb7 Predictive Analytics \xef\x82\xb7 IoT (Internet of Things) \xef\x82\xb7 Mobile App Development (iOS Android Windows) \xef\x82\xb7 Web Development \xef\x82\xb7 SAP HANA SAP UI5 \xef\x82\xb7 Cloud Solutions'

Headquartered in Walldorf Germany SAP is the market leader in enterprise application software. Founded in 1972 SAP has a rich history of innovation and growth as a true industry leader. SAP applications and services enable more than 238000 customers worldwide to operate profitably adapt continuously and grow sustainably. SAP has more than 66000 employees and sales and development locations in more than 130 countries worldwide.'
column10: b'POSITION DESCRIPTION SAP runs a Unified Communication (UC) infrastructure which delivers all aspects of client Collaboration (Voice Video Presence and Content Sharing). Support vendor engagement training and documentation and testing of vendor products (Cisco Telepresence Tandberg Polycom Siemens and Microsoft Lync) as well as identifying voice video and network faults for advanced troubleshooting and resolution. \xe2\x80\xa2 Develop and maintain Visio diagrams Word documents Excel \xe2\x80\xa2 You will also be involved in the Budgeting aspect to support and manage the growth of the organization utilizing SAP Core Business applications.'

column9: b'DuPont is a global Fortune 100 company focused on specialty products across a diverse business portfolio including Electronics & Imaging Industrial Biosciences Nutrition & Health Safety & Construction and Transportation & Advanced Polymers. This position resides in the Corporate Center for Analytical Sciences (CCAS) which provides analytical/measurement solutions to difficult problems encountered in discovery development and manufacturing.'
column10: b'In this position the Co-op will perform chemical and polymer characterization work in support of R&D and problem solving for DuPont businesses. Under the guidance of scientific staff the Co-op will conduct analytical science experiments interpret analytical results and suggest experiments or alternative approaches to develop technical business solutions. The Co-op will recognize erroneous or unexpected results make suggestions based on their analysis and conclusions and contribute to formulating work plans. Commonly used scientific tools including chromatography mass spectrometry NMR ICP light scattering thermal methods and rheometric methods will be used to characterize the structure chemical composition and behavior of a range of materials.'
column15: b'-Strong scientific curiosity and innovative problem solving -Ability and enthusiasm to learn new skills and tasks quickly -Successful completion of at least 2 years working towards a BS degree in Chemistry Materials Science Physics Engineering or a closely related science/engineering discipline -Attention to detail -Strong applied computing skills including data manipulation & statistical analysis applications; ability to master data-acquisition software packages -Excellent communication skills and ability to collaborate with cross-disciplinary teams with CCAS -Good organizational and interpersonal skills including self- management and the discipline to safely accomplish assigned work in a timely fashion -Ability to multitask'

column1: Your Part-Time Controller
column10: b'Your Part-Time Controller LLC (YPTC) is a leading accounting and financial services firm specializing in helping nonprofit organizations with their accounting financial reporting and financial management activities. With offices in the major metropolitan areas of Philadelphia PA New York NY Houston TX and Washington DC YPTC has a staff of over 150 accounting and financial professionals working with more than 450 clients. Our mission is to help our nonprofit clients do a better job at achieving their missions by helping them build efficient effective financial departments and by providing them with the financial data and information they need to run their organizations. We don\xe2\x80\x99t just prepare the numbers \xe2\x80\x93 we tell them what\xe2\x80\x99s going on behind the numbers! Our website is: www.yptc.com.'
column11: b'Job Description: The co-op students will be essential members of our Data Visualization Group (DVG). They will help YPTC develop its data visualization skills and by extension they will have meaningful impact on the performance of our nonprofit clients and the lives of their constituents. The successful co-op student will be a creative person with an entrepreneurial spirit who possesses the ability to think independently \xe2\x80\x9coutside the box.\xe2\x80\x9d This intern will work with one to three other interns in a cross-disciplinary team with interns coming from a variety of majors and backgrounds. Though YPTC is an accounting firm our clients are not accountants so interns with varied backgrounds that mirror our clients are attractive to us. This position will be based in our Center-City Philadelphia office will report to the Data Visualization Group Manager and will work closely with the President of our company. Co-ops will work a full-time schedule of 35 hours per week 9:00 AM to 5:00 PM Monday through Friday with an hour off for lunch. Co-ops will be paid for any YPTC paid holidays that occur during their internship. Paid Interns will also receive a proportional share of paid vacation sick and personal time plus any paid holidays that fall during their co-op period. YPTC will supply the technology it considers necessary to enable the interns to succeed. Co-ops will be expected to sign a non- disclosure/confidentiality agreement. Duties and Responsibilities: (1) Review data visualization tools and techniques currently being used by YPTC staff in their reporting to clients. (2) Propose superior ways of visually displaying key financial and non-financial information needed by our clients. Examples include dashboards video and interactive displays on computers tablets and smart phones. (3) Research test and evaluate data visualization tools and techniques currently available for disseminating financial and non-financial information. Such tools will include: Excel accounting software and apps available for smart phones and tablet computers. Both cloud based and locally installed solutions will be considered. (4) Prepare recommendations to YPTC management of those tools and techniques that appear most promising for use by our staff when they report to their clients. (5) Assist with the implementation of the recommended data visualization tools and techniques by helping to train YPTC staff in their use and by helping to troubleshoot problems during implementation. Learning objectives: Co-ops will have opportunities to develop team working skills by interacting and collaborating with other interns with senior YPTC management and with YPTC\xe2\x80\x99s professional staff. Interns will have the opportunity to learn skills required for successfully developing recommendations of their preferred data visualization tools and techniques and they will learn how to present their recommendations in a way as to encourage others to accept them. There will be opportunities to develop business writing skills as they draft recommendations business memorandum and training program materials. They will have opportunities to learn and improve their public speaking skills when they present their recommendations to our staff. Interns will also have opportunities to develop and conduct training classes for our staff. CO-OP STUDENTS WILL HAVE THE OPPORTUNITY TO INTERACT DIRECTLY WITH OUR CLIENTS FOR THE PURPOSE OF BETTER UNDERSTANDING THEIR DATA VISUALIZATION NEEDS. In summary: this is an excellent learning opportunity for the right independent thinking entrepreneurial minded individual.'
column15: b'No'
column16: b'We are currently looking for students with one or more of the following skills to round out our team: (1) PROGRAMMING SKILLS - Ability to program using Javascript and particularly D3.JS and other languages will be important to help us develop web-based data visualizations for our clients. (2) DESIGN SKILLS - Good visualizations are all about good design. Students majoring in design and related disciplines would have an excellent opportunity with us. An opportunity also exists to help us with design work for our general marketing efforts. (3) VIDEO EDITING - Video is an excellent medium to use for conveying visual information. It is a medium that we at YPTC intend to make greater use of for our clients. The right co-op student has an excellent opportunity to help us develop this skill. (4) INFORMATION DATA SCIENCE - Information data science and related disciplines are at the heart of good data visualizations. Students with these skills should very much consider applying for a spot on our DVG. (5) MICROSOFT EXCEL - Excellent Excel skills are a strong plus as this is a tool we use every day for all of our clients. (6) POWER BI - Power BI is just one of many data visualization tools currently available. Experience with one or more of these tools would be very helpful plus a strong desire to learn!'

column8: b'We offer results-driven people a place where they can make a difference. At the heart of what we do and believe is making healthcare better. We do this by collaborating with our customers to develop innovative products and services that ultimately improve the lives of patients. This is expressed through our mission: Together with our customers we are driven to make healthcare better which is delivered by our people each and every day. We grow talent. We give you the opportunity to develop your career based on your strengths and potential including the possibility to move geographically functionally laterally and vertically. Stryker is a career destination for engaged passionate and talented people who are driven to seek the innovation growth and opportunity that only we offer.'

column1: Sift Security (141902) Hiring Office Location: Menlo Park CA (1)
column8: b'Sift Security is a 3+ year old startup based in Menlo Park CA with a satellite office in Philadelphia PA. We are a team of experienced software engineers security practitioners and data scientists leveraging our previous experiences in academia and in industry to deliver innovative new solutions to pressing challenges in cyber security. Our executive team includes graduates of both Drexel University and the University of Pennsylvania with close ties to the Philadelphia area. Originally we built a graphical scalable security operations and incident response platform on top of open source software. Our latest product offering CloudHunter leverages graph analytics machine learning and detection rules to provide public cloud customers a platform for monitoring and securing their cloud infrastructure.'
column9: b'Our co-op will be a member of our core engineering team working closely with our team of 8 engineers to add new features and functionality to our product. Past co-ops have developed new components for interfacing with other products developed frameworks for automatically running scripts in container environments created new product demos and formulated detections for particular types of cyber- attacks. The co-op will report directly to the CTO and will be heavily focused on back-end engineering efforts to support new features based on existing and prospective customer requirements. The co-op will use internally developed tools open source tools and third party security products to develop new features. The student will get hands on experience with Scala Kafka Elastic Cassandra Docker AWS and other widely used technologies. The primary learning objectives for the student will first be leveraging their knowledge of existing tooling to decide how to best solve software engineering problems. Second will be to deliver working prototypes that can be incorporated into live production environments.'
column10: b'No'

column1: Philadelphia Fire Department (117121) Hiring Office Location: Philadelphia
column9: b'Philadelphia Fire Department'
column10: b"This is computer user support work at an advanced clerical level. Employees in this class perform a variety of support services directly for computer users in an assigned department including responding to requests for assistance from a helpdesk troubleshooting and resolving problems with computers over the phone by e-mail and in person and securing the assistance of higher level information technology staff when necessary. Employees in this class also provide informal advice and guidance and/or desktop one-on-one training and/or classroom and on-site training for groups for a wide variety of employees including managers supervisors professional and technical staff and clerical employees. Expertise with various types of computers applications and software packages is determined by the operational needs of the assigned department. Employees provide services in a variety of computer environments including local area networks wide area networks and terminals attached to a mainframe computer. Employees work under the supervision of an administrative or technical superior. Help-Desk Answers users' inquiries in person and via telephone concerning systems and software operations. Assists end users accessing computer systems and software including security and password problems. Acts as first level help desk assistant to provide technical support in answering questions pertaining to software applications and computer equipment. Answers evaluates and prioritizes incoming telephone calls voice mail e-mail and in-person requests for assistance and sets end-user expectations for resolution time and communicates changes in status as necessary Assists users with the operation of their personal computers. Recommends and/or performs minor actions to correct problems with hardware and/or software on the telephone and in person; refers more difficult problems to technical specialists. Troubleshooting / Desktop Support Troubleshoots and identifies software and/or hardware and/or network and/or telecommunications problems as called in by end-users using diagnostic equipment as necessary and follows through to resolution. Provides desktop support of all standard applications including but not limited to Windows operating systems. Travels to worksites as necessary. Interviews users to gather information about problems and if possible leads user through diagnostic procedures to determine the problem. Standards and Procedures Adheres to security procedures and assists in administration and adherence to established standards and procedures. Installation Configuration and Testing of Hardware and Software Installs configures and tests hardware and software to meet user needs including internal tape drives CD-ROM drives modems fax cards printers scanners telecommunications equipment and network cards. Assists technical staff in installing maintaining and/or upgrading PC-networked software and peripheral equipment such as monitors keyboards printers cable and wiring connections phones and audiovisual equipment. Inventory/Product Evaluation Maintains up-to-date and accurate inventory and documentation of software and/or hardware and/or telecommunication system and maintenance log for all service requests and communicates inventory changes equipment needs and low inventory levels. Reviews evaluates and makes hardware/software recommendations and discusses with immediate supervisor and other staff. Securing Support Works closely with other IT staff to insure clear communication on outstanding issues observed trends in end user support and user problems. Works directly with higher level IT support staff to resolve difficult problems including LAN WAN and special application issues. Training Schedules conducts and assists in training and instructional sessions for employees in data entry and retrieval procedures software applications for personal computers and network and/or Internet telecommunications and voicemail policies features and operations. Trains in unique departmental systems such as FACTS/PACWIS court reporting resource tracking etc. and other systems applications utilized by assigned departments. Recommends provides and develops training including development of instructional and reference materials for the training sessions. Data Entry Maintenance and Retrieval/Report Preparation Enters and/or updates data into system. Maintains information and activities in the databases and maintains integrity of files and follows conventions for the use as required. Creates updates and maintains automated reporting tools such as spreadsheets. Checks printouts of processed data to correct errors in coding or input. Reviews source materials and determines data to be entered into database. Retrieves data from computerized records. Executes prints and distributes reports for departmental distribution. Prepares designs and graphic layouts to be used alone or with accompanying text in presentations newsletters billing formats training materials and a variety of reporting formats. General Clerical Performs manual record-keeping document distribution typing and other clerical tasks; maintains integrity of computerized records and files. Performs related work as required."
column15: b'KNOWLEDGE OF: Microsoft Office Suite (Word Excel PowerPoint Access) Various software packages and operating systems currently used by the department including but not limited to Windows 95 97 98 2000 and Millenium Lotus Notes cc:mail Norton Antivirus WordPerfect Netscape Navigator Novell network operating system and communication applications Computer Network system practices Basic LAN/WAN concepts Customer service principles and practices Data entry maintenance and retrieval procedures Report preparation based on retrieval and formatting of data contained in databases Office practices and procedures SKILL IN: Written and verbal communication Data entry and retrieval ABILITY TO: Identify problems and resolve issues in a timely manner Learn the function operations and computer needs of the organization supported Learn other department designated application software packages Deliver hands-on and classroom training for individuals and groups of users Service computer devices and to diagnose and resolve stoppages and failures Install software Repair or replace hardware on PC systems if required by job assignment Install and perform preventative maintenance on printers scanners and other peripheral equipment if required by job assignment Work independently in high-paced environment Communicate with all levels of staff Establish and maintain effective working relationships with departmental associates'
column17: b'Beginner - Limited or no previous work experience/first Co-op or Intermediate - Some related work or volunteer experience/second Co-op or Advanced - Previous related work experience/final Co-op'

Technical Skills: \xe2\x80\xa2 Strong experience with supporting and troubleshooting Microsoft technologies. \xe2\x80\xa2 Minimum 0-1 years\xe2\x80\x99 experience with Microsoft Windows in a server/infrastructure support role. Experience with any of the following technologies would be definite assets: \xe2\x80\xa2 Data Protection/Encryption \xe2\x80\xa2 VMware/Hyper-V \xe2\x80\xa2 HIPAA \xe2\x80\xa2 Fortigate Firewall Administration (or Similar Firewall Experience) \xe2\x80\xa2 SQL Server Administration \xe2\x80\xa2 AD/GPO Setup and Management \xe2\x80\xa2 VPN client configuration and trouble shooting'

column9: b'At the EY Intuitive studio our designers developers researchers technologists and strategists work alongside businesses of all sizes with one goal in mind: to create useful apps websites and software. Whether it\xe2\x80\x99s to overcome a specific challenge or complete a transaction we\xe2\x80\x99ve always got our users\xe2\x80\x99 needs in mind. To be considered for an interview at Ernst & Young LLP (EY): \xe2\x80\xa2 Apply using your school\xe2\x80\x99s online recruiting system for only one of our positions \xe2\x80\xa2 Apply through our online system at www.ey.com/us/apply. That starts with a culture that believes in giving you the training opportunities and creative freedom to make things better. Whenever you join however long you stay the exceptional EY experience lasts a lifetime. And with a commitment to hiring and developing the most passionate people we\xe2\x80\x99ll make our ambition to be the best employer by 2020 a reality.'
column10: b'The opportunity As a User Experience Development Co-Op we\xe2\x80\x99ll teach you to create digital experiences that come to life for well-known global brands. That will mean using established development tools as well new and emerging techniques. You\xe2\x80\x99ll collaborate with a likeminded team of experienced professionals to develop and help implement new ideas. What to expect You\xe2\x80\x99re likely to work on a diverse portfolio of projects in web and app design development and research. This will mostly include transactional financial projects so you\xe2\x80\x99ll be receiving designer specifications from clients and helping to create front-end code with potential to work on more complex projects. You\xe2\x80\x99ll be assigned a dedicated mentor from the start so you\xe2\x80\x99ll also have opportunities to discuss your career goals and influence your future with us with somebody who knows your strengths personally. Your key responsibilities \xe2\x80\xa2 Creating responsive codes for transactional apps and websites \xe2\x80\xa2 Sharing your knowledge of technology and current trends with colleagues \xe2\x80\xa2 Thinking creatively to overcome complex challenges \xe2\x80\xa2 Contributing your work ideas and new technology skills internally and externally \xe2\x80\xa2 Learning new skills and taking on responsibilities outside your comfort zone in a culture where people will always be ready to support you'

column15: b'A successful candidate will have the following personal and professional characteristics: \xe2\x80\xa2 Sophomore junior or senior year student who is completing a finance math economics or computer science major with an interest in finance \xe2\x80\xa2 Interest in understanding the inner workings of a financial firm and financial instruments \xe2\x80\xa2 Well-rounded students with an outstanding track record of academic achievement and broad based extra-curricular interests The ideal candidate for an intern position will be someone who has or is interested in: \xe2\x80\xa2 Strong desire to work collaboratively with the team \xe2\x80\xa2 High standard of professionalism \xe2\x80\xa2 Result driven attitude and ability to work under pressure \xe2\x80\xa2 Outstanding attention to detail and strong organization skills'

column1: Parkway Corporation (124909) Hiring Office Location: Philadelphia
column9: b'Privately Held Real Estate and Development Company seeking a IT Analyst with an interest in Software Development to help support a robust IT staff. Parkway\xe2\x80\x99s geographic presence ranges across the United States and Canada. Parkway\xe2\x80\x99s development focus has been on mixed use projects that have included retail and restaurant space general and medical office and both midrise niche and highrise super luxury residential condominiums. Currently the Company\xe2\x80\x99s mix of owned leased and managed parking facilities encompasses over 400 employees and nearly 15000 parking spaces. Parkway uses www.gocanvas.com. 6) Understanding of software testing approaches as they relate to software functionality and intended design. 7) Inquisitive nature - "Why does this work this way? - I\'m going to find out and this is how I plan to do it". 8) Thoroughness as a fundamental characteristic is prized. 9) Using SQL Enterprise Manager candidate will have constant exposure to production data. 10) High attention to detail along with extremely careful treatment of this data is required.'
