column1: Philadelphia Mental Health Care Corporation (140585) Hiring Office Location: Philadelphia
column9: b"PMHCC a not-for-profit organization began as The Philadelphia Mental Health Care Corporation in 1987 for the City of Philadelphia in order to implement a major grant from the Robert Wood Johnson Foundation's Program for Chronic Mental Illness. One of nine national grants the funding was to assist the Philadelphia Office of Mental Health realize its vision for a unified mental health system to provide affordable housing effective case management and a broad range of psycho- social and vocational programs for people with mental illness. Today PMHCC makes a major contribution to Philadelphia's citizens by serving as an umbrella organization for special programs and initiatives and providing critical administrative services to mental health substance abuse intellectual disabilities human services special health and related city offices and health programs. This position will be within the Behavioral Health and Justice Related Services Division of PMHCC."
column10: b'The Forensic Research Assistant is responsible for helping the Business Intelligence Team (BIT) track and monitor individuals who are found incompetent to stand trial and other related forensic populations in Philadelphia. This position will be involved in tasks that are related to collecting information from the court systems in Philadelphia as well as clinically-related projects regarding the forensic population involved in the behavioral health system. This position is expected to support the data entry and research needs for the various business units within the Division. Duties and Responsibilities: Assist with daily operations of the BIT Provide information for existing reports and engage in development of reports for new initiatives Work with business units to help define specific metrics and operationalize program activity data Assist in the collection of data from various public and private sources Assist the BIT with data analysis and presentation Organize the BIT\xe2\x80\x99s incoming and outgoing data reports Participate in data development discussions regarding efficiency and potential improvements to facilitate data collection processes Transform data across different software Perform ongoing maintenance for data quality with business units Literature search support related to legal and clinical systems for the behavioral health population Perform additional duties as assigned Essential Functions: Ability to physically perform the duties and to work in the environmental conditions required such as: (1) maneuvering in office space \xe2\x80\x93 reaching file cabinets fax and copier machines when necessary; (2) travelling locally via public transportation and on foot from 123 S. Broad Street to 1101 Market Street CBH and various other destinations as needed; (3) possessing a valid driver\xe2\x80\x99s license; (4) passing criminal background check; and (5) effectively using computers databases and related common office software packages such as Microsoft Word and Excel and other basic computer programs.'

column1: Temple University School of Medicine (35028) Hiring Office Location: Philadelphia
column3: Brain Computer Interface (BCI) Software and Interface Development Research Assistant Philadelphia
column9: b"This Co-Op is located at Temple University's MDA/ALS Center of Hope which houses a multidisciplinary center for the care of people living with ALS and neuromuscular diseases."
column10: b'Brain computer interfaces provide a communication pathway using hardware and software to enable control of computers through cerebral/cortical activity. BCIs hold tremendous potential to assist and augment human functions and allow independence to disabled individuals. The BCI Development Research Assistants will work together to develop the Neurable BCI platform which uses machine learning to classify EEG control signals in real time. The BCI Development team will work together to develop programming to interface the Neurable headset with VR headsets/computers in order to enable communication and environmental control. As the Research assistant you will be responsible for developing software for the Neurable Headset to interface with the VIVE headset and computer software that already exists for communication and control. You will work as part of a team. The Research Assistant will also be tasked with the collection and analysis of data/beta testing with healthy individuals and individuals that have been diagnosed with amyotrophic lateral sclerosis (ALS) using the system as it develops. In order to expand the capabilities of the system and enhance the power of the system the Research Assistants are encouraged to reach out to any collaborators who could add expertise to the development of these systems. The overall goal is to develop a user friendly system that circumvents the need for speech or movement to enable access communication and provide entertainment to disabled people.The primary focus of the Research Associate will be the programming and development of the Neurable System but other opportunities within the BCI program will be available.'

column1: School District of Philadelphia (104966) Hiring Office Location: Philadelphia (1)
column2: Data Analyst Intern- District Performance Office/Philadelphia PA
column8: b'The District Performance Office (DPO) is responsible for driving continuous improvement in district school and student performance through the use of high-quality data aligned accountability systems strategic analytics and cross-system data integration. Our goal is to support the continuous improvement of our schools for all children. We achieve this goal by communicating to District leadership principals teachers parents students and community members about the successes of individual schools and the district as a whole. The primary tasks of the DPO include generating data analyses and reports on a number of measures at the student school and district levels. We aim to recognize high achievement and progress as well as identify areas in need of support to help improve public education in the city of Philadelphia in accordance with the District\xe2\x80\x99s Action Plan.'
column9: b'As a DPO Data Analyst Intern you will be an integral part of our efforts to support the production maintenance and continuous improvement of our data reporting systems. In this role you will be exposed to the entire data life-cycle which includes gathering data from multiple sources processing data to be digestible by varied stakeholders and the dissemination of data products throughout the district. Your responsibilities may include but are not limited to: Developing visualizations for our QlikBAM dashboards Performing data cleaning and quality assurance tasks using a scripting language (e.g. R or Stata) Drafting documentation on internal and external facing data products processes and user guides Assisting in developing and maintaining basic scripts utilizing Qlik Sense and SQL'
